Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Katie J
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on here we (a young couple) were slightly apprehensive about the hotel, however it was lovely and looks just like the pictures- just a lot bigger. It doesn't have a wardrobe or drawers which could be a bit weird however it is very clean, has a big side to put things on and has a coat stand which they give you hangers for, for things which cannot stay in the suitcase. It has a tv, the bed is huge, the shower is amazing and we didn't have any problems with hot water. We also had a massive window in the room which was nice. It was near the city centre, only 5/6 stops away on the metro which was quick and cheap if you buy a 24 hr / 48 hr pass. The metro station was under 2 min walk away, The staff were really friendly also and made an effort to help you find your way in the city. Take a hairdryer as this isn't provided. Basically we would go back again and would definately recommend to friends,

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Natasha B
Reviews.Content: Hotel looked very cool on pics, but the room turned out to be small, extremely cold and with no window! No wardrobe, shelf or even a hanger, very weird place indeed. Didnt like the overall impression so won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for one night, alone”
Reviews.Author: Greenwithenvy
Reviews.Content: As others have said, this hotel has some good points - in particular, it's a bit different and that is fun in itself. I stayed here because it was near the Zuid station and the university where I had business. Some things would annoy me if I had to stay longer than one night - there were only two or three clothes hangers, there was nowhere to put a toiletries bag in the bathroom except on the floor, there was nowhere to put the soap down in the shower, there was no hairdryer and almost no bathroom stuff. I can imagine the lack of a door on the bathroom might be inconvenient if you weren't alone. Another thing that could be remedied is how cold and concretey the lift area is. It's not a 'homely' hotel at all. The walls were a bit thin too. Breakfast was adequate. Privacy is an issue if you have a room facing the internal courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Better if certain aspects were looked at...”
Reviews.Author: glg2580
Reviews.Content: On the whole I really enjoyed this hotel, it is located right next to Zuid station (walking distance) and the rooms are reasonably sized. The mood lighting is amazing and so is the breakfast bar that you have in the rooms too. On the whole the hotel was goo, but the following points really brought down the hotel experience: 1 - Firstly, Every morning... Well around 11am when taking a shower, (all three days, the shower was cold). 2 - You, cant control your room temperature of your room?!?!? It was a cold room and due to the heating being 'centrally located' it was totally controlled by staff - which made it awkward to go to reception to constantly ask for more heat!? 3 - Me and my partner stayed in one room, yet the beds were to single beds that sank in the middle due to loose support, this meant that we kept being pushed to the middle of the bed, quite annoying after a busy day around town. I think when going to Amsterdam again I would choose the CitizenM hotel for a much better experience - the rooms were clean and suitable, its just these points really brought it down. The breakfast didn't look all that great for 11 Euros but that's an opinion. There are no hair dryers or kettles in rooms, which can also be a pain. Its also easy to get into the centre of Amsterdam by the Number 5 tram, with a taxi costing around 17-20 Euro's. Next time I will choose Citizen M Hotel (a few minutes walk away).

Reviews.Title: “Cheep and cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: orange63
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in the winter of 2008 as a couple. Got a very cheap deal online, so was happy with that! Found the hotel easily. Was a little bit outta the city...but the tram was just outside so that was okay! Very large rooms which were really cool! Took us a while to figure out how to change the colour of the lights though! Internet access was provided. Only complaint is there was a weird smell coming from the shower..but this disappeared after a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for low cost business stay”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: A decent hotel, if not excellent. I used it as a low cost business hotel - it's built into one of the World Trade Centre buildings on the lower floors. It's easy to get to, it's a 2 min walk from Zuid train station which is 7 mins from Schipol airport. The rooms are somewhat odd, not sure I'd want to share one with someone else due to the pod structure which means there is no door/side wall on the bathroom area. This is probably fine if you're not a prudish Brit. The bathroom styling is funky, if impractical - no shelves anywhere to put things on for instance. The bed however was comfy, TV picked up UK programmes, free wifi, lots of weird lighting combinations. Not much of a view - open the curtains and could see people at their desks in the WTC. Make sure you're dressed, :-) Breakfast was ok, a small selection of ham, cheese and bread along with cereal. All you need if not expecting luxury. Summary: Decent enough hotel for the money, just don't expect excellence.

Reviews.Title: “Different idea of clean!!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location with easy access to both train and metro. Funky looking hotel on the surface but with poor lighting, dirty sheets and very few amenities I doubt very much I'd stay here again!! Room was cold and when we complained were given strange looks and a small plug in heater. Bed wasnt terribly clean - nothing at all was done about this! Funky mood lighting didnt work, neither did the hot water on day 2!

Reviews.Title: “not great”
Reviews.Author: art p
Reviews.Content: on a bad side the room had no windows!, poor lighting and no doors for the toilet, no fridge. It was not possible to regulate the air conditioning, I had to have a sip of water every hour. shabby finish of the room. On a plus side it was cheap with good connection with the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: The-Sunshine-Gull
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked this hotel as a Birthday present for me. A long weekend in Amsterdam. From looking on the Website and on TripAdvisor i was very excited about the modern, funky rooms and wasn't disappointed when we finally got there. The room was a good size and the LED lights around the bed were just as good as it had looked online. Was initially a bit worried about the lack of door on the bathroom but i'll repeat what others have said in their reviews. It doesn't detract from the stay at all, the entrance is a different end to the bedroom area so it's not like you're lying in bed looking into the toilet. You get used to it pretty quickly! :) Plenty of plug sockets which is always good, Wonderful powerful shower, lots of towels (we stayed for 3 nights and had a fresh one every day) The staff in reception were very helpful. The location was perfect, a 5-10 minute train from Schipol airport gets you to the train station by the hotel, hotel is a 2 minute walk from the train station and to get into town the Trams go every 10 minutes or so and take about 20minutes to get to Central Station (However we got off at the Museum and walked the rest of the way into town because there was lovely things along the way) When we went all the canals were frozen over, everybody was ice-skating along them. The one negative about the hotel is that our room got very hot, the windows don't open and we didn't have any air con controls but that was about it. Overall, i would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Amsterdam, great loacation, good rooms, clean, modern and a very decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed it!”
Reviews.Author: mdstephenson
Reviews.Content: Would regard this a s a great find....unlike some previous reviewers we found it straight away using the directions from the website. It's not in the city centre but it is ideally placed for train/tram and bus as it is situated within the World Trade Centre. Rooms are great, very funky and comfortable...I'd definitely stay again (and probably will).

Reviews.Title: “"Difficult to find"”
Reviews.Author: Slybacon_48
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really cool with groovy decorations. The rooms were very clean and service excellent. Qbic hotel is quite a distance from Amsterdam central but we caught the subway quite cheaply. I got a great price for two nights through trip advisor emails so it was worth staying on the outskirts of city and using subway into town. We spent a good 15 min on arrival trying to find the hotel but people were really friendly and willing to help. It was surprising the people in the area that didn't know the building had a hotel in it. (It is a huge building with a lot of offices in it)

Reviews.Title: “VERY CHEAP LOVELY ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: Nikky G
Reviews.Content: We arrived early on my birthday sunday morning, the man asked for my details to chek our reservation and I wasnt even given so much as a welcome or a Happy Birthday! We was told check in wasnt until anytime after 11, however, we wasnt invited to sit down in the hotel or given any friendly information about the area and where we could go meanwhile so we asked to leave our bags there so we could explore the city. We was told to just leave our bags in the lobby which i felt a bit dodgy about as they wasnt locked away. It is about 3 minutes from Amsterdam Zuid station where there is a nice Burger King and two small Albert Heijn stores (supermarkets) where the staff are very helpful and give you as much help as you need. It also takes about 15 minutes by train to get to Amsterdam Central or 10 minutes by tram. You can buy a 24hour travel card for 7euros. When we came back to check into the hotel we was handed our keys and given directions to our room which was on the first floor. When we got into the hotel room there was no electric, when I asked the man at reception why this was, he told me you had to put your key into the electric device next to the door, which would of been helpful if he told me this before we got to our room. The Tv was not in the middle of the bed like shown in the pictures, it was at then end of the bed with lots of visible wires. The stools at the end of the bed are nearly impossible to sit on properly as they are so small! The lights are absolutely brilliant and the wallpaper was amazing aswell, it reacted with the neon lights coming from the bed! I have no complaints about the lights as they just fascinated me! The shower was absolutely lovely aswell, I didnt want to get out of it! Also the matress is one of those mould matressess wich was very very comfy! On two occasions when me and my friend were sleeping, the cleaners just came into our rooms, said something in dutch and walked back out, which was VERY creepy! When i got out of bed to open the door, I asked the man if he came in and he said yes and that he was room service? A knock on the door would of been much appreciated? The vending machine have a wide range of chocolates and drinks, they also sell pot noodle like things for 3euruos but as we didnt have kettles in our room, we had to PAY 1.50 to use hot water, which wasnt hot enough so we then had to use the microwave. We done this on two occasions, and on the second occasion the member of staff who was in the lobby on the computer complained at me for using the microwave and making the lobby smell of burning? NO FOOD WAS BURNT IT JUST SMELT LIKE A CHICKEN POT NOODLE! The pillows are so flat that I had to ask for spare ones, which i was told the hotel didnt have (which must of been a lie, which hotel doesnt have spare pillows?). I was offered a bundle of towels to place under my pillow instead which was not useful at all! The staff look at you like you are on drugs when you speak to them! Especially the main man that was at the reception. We was not told about any of the services the hotel provide eg. breakfast. We just had to look at posters around the hotel and figure out for ourselves. Our key cards kepty breaking and we kept getting given new ones! There is no smoking area and no seats outside!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, no fuss, good location with very easy access to city centre & airport”
Reviews.Author: keyrelocation
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for our 4 day trip to Amsterdam and it is pretty much as described in the title above, really. The staff were friendly and happy to help when you needed it. The room was simple but a good size, but unless you are travelling with someone you know very well, you may want to consider another hotel as the lack of a door to the bathroom could be an issue. The mood lighting can take a few minutes to master and like most other hotels, the bathroom lighting is not ideal for putting on your make up. There is a full length mirror but bizarrely it is located on a wall right next to the bed, so not exactly great for us girls who would like to see a whole outfit rather than just to the knees. Sometimes I wish hotels would consult women more when designing an hotel room. We just really want a full-length mirror and decent lighting for doing your make up! Oh, and a plug socket close to a mirror for plugging in your hairdryer. But the Qbic did get the plug in the right location, though with a plug right by the mirror in the bathroom, even if the mirror was situated a little bit high up - I am 5'1". :) A couple of bad points: rooms at the back seem to overlook the WTC bin area and can get noisy in the early hours - we were on the 2nd floor; the room got very warm at times and you can't control the aircon and the window did not open; the room got no natural light due to the location overlooking the enclosed bin area. Although it is located quite a distance out of town, the no. 5 tram which runs every 8 minutes or so takes you straight in in about 10-15 mins depending where you need to be. From the airport, the hotel is one stop on the train. If you need to get back to the hotel late at night, a txi costs between 13-20 euro. Overall, a good hotel that offers something a little different with little fuss and contributed to a great weekend. If you like live music, try Bourbon Street Amsterdam - great Saturday night! Good pizzas at Piccolinos in the centre. The Old Sailor pub in the Red Light District is also good fun and one of the few good places that stay open late on a Sunday night.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for great location”
Reviews.Author: NausicaaNL
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay in order to be at an early meeting the next day. This hotel is located inside the Amsterdam WTC, which is a business district. This means it's not exactly a bubbly location at night, but brilliant if you have to connect to a train or subway (both 1 minute away), or the airport (7 minutes away). The room was larger than I expected, and looked pretty much like the pictures. A 'bed and bathroom' combination thing with funky lighting and flatscreen. two bar stools and a lounger. Not much else, but I didn't need more. The room could have been cleaned a bit better, although it did not bother me too much. The usable surface was clean, and the sheets and towels were absolutely spotless. Due to the design bed, there are some edges and corners collecting dust, the overall impression would be even better if more attention would be paid there. Pro: fantastic location for business district, public transport and airport for a great price. Funky room with super bed Quite nice lobby for reading a book or having breakfast Free (fast) wifi Con: location quite deserted at night Room a bit empty, not very suitable for romantic get-aways Room was a bit dusty

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: James P
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay and at a brilliant price. Really close to the airport and best connected to Amsterdam via the metro. The room was spacious, clean and furnished really nicely with a modern twist! Only downside is that the shower/loo doesn't have a door - but guess that adds to the modern/minimal feel. Staff were also very helpful and friendly. Would definitely consider staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fab stay for a couple for a weekend”
Reviews.Author: ktnanci
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our anniversary this was back in 2009 though, great to reach by train from the aiport, the entrance was strange huge building full of office workers. Hotel was fab though, all very open and the room was great not much storage for clothes I think 2 coat hangers, but the bed was very comfy with flat screen tv, although the glare from the window behind meant we couldnt see it! The bathroom was great situated in the middle of the room, so if your with someone whom you rather didnt see you in the shower or on the loo, this is a no no for you. Otherwise great transport links close by. Not so good for getting into at night, we nearly got locked out and had no idea how to get in/reach security.

Reviews.Title: “Funky”
Reviews.Author: Davsim3
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Qbic hotel for 1 night and loved it. The futuristic style of the rooms was something different and a welcome change from other hotels I have been staying at. Everything was modern and I loved the king size bed. The one thing I would say is if your staying with someone in this hotel, make sure you know them well because there is no door on the bathroom . There isn't many places to eat in the area apart from a Burger King in the train station and wagamama's noodle restaraunt which was way over priced, so it might pay to stop at a supermarket on the way. There is a vending machine in the lobby with pot noodles if you forget.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky little hotel, lots of fun”
Reviews.Author: swazzer
Reviews.Content: It's a great place to stay for anyone looking for a unique experience. It truly embodies the spirit of Amsterdam. The rooms are small but comfortable with clean and stylish bathrooms. The mood lighting greatly adds to the experience.

Reviews.Title: “New experience”
Reviews.Author: K G
Reviews.Content: It's the first time I spent at this kind of hotel in my life. Great service, great price, and perfect location. It's very easy to travel by train from the Airport. And the hotel is right in front of the station. The staff members were very helpful and very friendly. Would highly recommend to this place.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: SaraGiardini
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel and its particular design! Very funny! The only thing is that it's a little bit far from the centre but there's the subway just behind the corner! I loved the leds in the bedroom...fantastic! I'll come back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Modern boutique hotel, fae away from the action.”
Reviews.Author: anggingyin
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at Qbic Amsterdam. It is a chic, boutique hotel, slightly overhyped if you ask me. Location wise, it is accessible via Metro Line 51 and Tram Line 5. Precise instructions were given to us prior to arrival hence there was no problem locating the hotel. Qbic is located away from the action in Amsterdam, about 20 mins ride to Centraal Station, Dam, Museum area. OK if you don't mind a bit of travel. By the way, there is no supermarket, eateries near the Qbic hotel although these are available via vending machines in the lobby. The room is nice but not worth paying the premium. Big bed flat pillows. Noticed that a thick layer of dirt has accumulated underneath the bed, not obvious due to the green and red lights inside the room. There is no door concealing the bathroom and shower area, if you don't mind the lack of privacy. I did noticed the inconsistency of service in Qbic, I got free hot water on my 1st night but had to pay euro 1.50 on my 2nd night. I would much appreciate if the reception staff had been more friendly and helpful. Overall, OK experience. Nothing to be excited about. I probably will give Qbic a miss on my next visit to Amsterdam. Choose something near town if you want to be close to the attractions in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Standard!”
Reviews.Author: Lyla8
Reviews.Content: Lovely place but very far the centre. Not walking distant rather pay and stay central but trams are very regular so that's an ok! Rooms are very cool- no door between the toilet and the bedroom!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect every time”
Reviews.Author: gynmd
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Qbic 3-4 times for business, and it is consistently excellent. The WiFi is the best I've seen, and I travel for work all the time. The bed is clearly something they invested in, and the staff are friendly and helpful. There are no hidden charges, and it's pretty inexpensive overall. I like the fact that this is well designed for business travelers like me; outlets are plentiful, and lighting is good. There isn't any dresser or extra furniture, but that works for me since I live out of my suitcase anyway. My only minor requests would be for somewhat more comfortable chairs at the desk and a little more room in the bathroom to put toiletries. Otherwise, this is excellent, and the location mere steps away from Amsterdam Zuid station makes commuting stress-free. I can be in my room, leave and catch the train to Schipol two minutes later without breaking a sweat.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 223marty
Reviews.Content: enjoyed our stay at this hotel, modern hotel very friendly staff, rooms a bit different to the norm, bathroom requires that you are very comfortable with the person you are sharing with, not for a couple that are still trying to impress each other. location is a bit out from centre but night bus service available if you are out later than midnight when the trams and metro finish. zuid station is beside hotel which takes you to centre.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, the washroom is strange, location okay”
Reviews.Author: 8sah13
Reviews.Content: The hotel: overall the hotel was quite nice and clean. Location: It is in south amsterdam, quite a distance from the city center and main tourist attractions. However, it is a 1 minute walk from amsterdam zuid station, which has many options to take you to the city center. you won't wait more than 10 minutes for a train or tram, and the total ride is 20 minutes. If you are in town for business the location is fantastic (directly connected to amsterdam world trade center). Service: the hotel staff were friendly and helpful. nothing exceptional, but certainly no concerns! Rooms: The room was a decent size with a relatively comfortable double bed. The lighting was more tacky than interesting. Good television with lots of english channels. The bar beside the bed was very convenient. Great free wi-fi in the room. The only downside was the washroom, which has no door. Overall: the hotel is a good value and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Ã�kos N
Reviews.Content: Modern designed room! Nice breakfast! Very kind and help stuff! Super transportation!

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be visiting again!”
Reviews.Author: Issyrazack R
Reviews.Content: Great value for money. Fantastic rooms and wonderful service. Upon reading past reviews of the hotel, it is clear they take feedback on board and make necessary changes to provide the most enjoyable stay. A real gem!

Reviews.Title: “It promises - It delivers”
Reviews.Author: stu.bec
Reviews.Content: Every now and then you stay somewhere that you know you will remember, somewhere that stands out from the all too common standard of most mid range hotels. But when you are paying a budget price, for a mid range place you are curious, if not suspicious. Qbic is a concept, it is like nothing I have ever experienced before in terms of a hotel, in many ways it tries to break the mould of a bog standard normality and succeeds. Check in was a breeze, the staff were extremely friendly, it bore the welcoming of a guesthouse, the comfort of home and the feel of a Marriott that has been kitted out by some rich boy with a love for gadgets and lights. For me it epitomised Amsterdam and the Netherlands, the lessaiz faire attitude, the modern way to do things and the belief in something that is not normal, but great nonetheless. The only downside is that this hotel is out of town and really there isnâ€™t a great deal to do. It is only twenty minutes, but if this hotel was in the centre it would have got five stars from me. Take nothing away from the hotel though, this is one place that promises â€“ and delivers.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Hotel but no windows in room”
Reviews.Author: Greeneyes1982
Reviews.Content: I've just stayed at the Qbic hotel for 3 nights with my partner. It was our first time in Amsterdam & we were looking for a fairly cheap deal, which I think we did get for around Â£120 Room only. We first arrived at the Hotel around 11am, we knew we couldn't check-in until 3pm, but they advised the room would probably be ready by 2pm. We were able to leave our luggage by reception desk, so we could go off and explore. I would say ok if nothing of value in your luggage as the bags were not locked away. Breakfast was an added cost if you wanted it, however we had it on the 2nd day only and there wasn't much choice. Ok if you just wanted tea/coffee, Orange Juice & a croissant. The overall interior of the Hotel was very much in the style of Ikea. The room was quirky, as seen on the internet but our room didn't have any windows which we did find quite claustrophobic. There appeared to be a temperature control system, but you were unable to change it yourself. We did find we woke up very stuffy.....on the upside it is more than adequate for a short city break stay. Staff were pleasant but not overly helpful. It was very much a help yourself concept with the glorified vending machines in reception that stocked the usual pot noodle, chocolate, juice.....Oh and deodrant. We did enjoy our stay, but 3 nights was really enough in this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel for short stays”
Reviews.Author: Ellie R
Reviews.Content: I was really excited about staying at Qbic, particularly because of its retro, 80s-space-disco look, and generally it met my expectations. I stayed there with my husband for two nights in early October. We arrived later than expected, at about 11.30pm on Friday night. I called ahead to explain that we would be delayed (impromptu dinner at an amazing restaurant) and was assured that this was fine - the guy on the phone was really lovely and told us to have fun! So that was a good first impression. We got a little lost on our way there, the directions said the tram stop was called Strawinskylaan but now seems to just be called Amsterdam Zuid so we were a bit confused, but eventually found our way to Qbic. We had to be let into reception by some fellow guests as the duty manager seemed to have gone on a break, but he reappeared soon afterwards. Loved the room: the bed was extremely comfortable, the TV had a great range of channels, and the shower was really powerful. I had already seen from photos/comments that the bathroom had no door and neither of us minded, but I imagine it could come as a surprise to some people. Perhaps this should be made explicit on the website? There was no hairdryer in the bathroom which didn't matter to me but does usually come as standard in hotels these days. There was a great buffet selection of food for breakfast, and you can tell they're catering to a youngish market by serving it until 11am. We arrived for breakfast at about 10.50am just to have something quick before going out but were told a bit rudely that breakfast "was served until 11am, for next time" by one of the staff - he appeared to have got the time wrong. Not a big deal but might be an idea for the staff just to check their facts before telling off guests! We didn't make use of the vending machines although I thought they were a nice touch. We really liked the magazines and maps supplied in reception. The location was fine for us; being a business district, it felt a bit like staying in Canary Wharf (to draw an analogy from London) and was very quiet over the weekend, so not that easy to pop out to the shops and get something you might have forgotten - but we spent most of the time in the centre anyway. There were train engineering works over the weekend which meant the trains from Amsterdam Zuid weren't running, and we had to take a replacement bus to Duivendrecht (e.g. for onward journeys to Utrecht etc.) but the metro was working fine. Generally it was a nice stay, cheap and cheerful, and I would stay there again for short trips.

Reviews.Title: “Concept hotel with a little way to go, but not bad overall.”
Reviews.Author: risingsun D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at QBic with my boyfriend in April. The overwhelming memory I have is that we seemed to be the only people staying there!? I don't necessarily mean there is a reason for this as the overall stay was adequate and the features of the room (like the bed etc) were unique and I enjoyed having them there. Few qualms: -Room was a bit shabby (few wires hanging out) , but I am a student and I have stayed in FAR worse and it just pedantic to rattle on about such things. Most importantly the bathroom & sheets were immaculate. -There was no safe place to store my luggage as I had an evening flight but had to vacate my room, but again, not a reason not to stay here. -However, I would NOT stay here with someone I was not close to, as the bathroom did not have a door! Haha. Perhaps other rooms have this option... I have seen people complaining about the price, this hotel is very cheap for what you get. Sure it is fairly far away from the centre of town, but you are in Amsterdam! It has a brilliant and fairly cheap transport system which means you can save a few pennies for..other stuff. Staff were very very friendly and helpful aswell!

Reviews.Title: “A good value hotel but slightly to far from the centre.”
Reviews.Author: Brk21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you are on a budget. We stayed here for 3 nights and were very pleased with how cheap we managed to get the hotel. The rooms are interesting and the lighting is fun, the only two real criticisms are the openplan/open door bathroom which can at times be a bit irritating if you require privacy! I wouldn't recommend this hotel unless you are pretty close to your travelling companion! Also, cleaning of the room was a bit hit and miss and it would have been nice to have the room properly cleaned and the bed properly made at least once during our stay. The staff are friendly and helpful and the hotel is convenient for the airport and WTC. The tram ride to the centre is not too bad and with an IAmsterdamCard all tram travel is included which kept costs down. The distance can also work in Qbic's favour because it is nice to escape from the centre after a busy day sightseeing. All in all a great value for money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a bizarre concept, implemented badly”
Reviews.Author: Steve P
Reviews.Content: What can I say about the Qbic? On first arrival, there was no one at reception and I had to phone someone to come and check me in. So I took a seat next to the cosy "fire", or rather television with a looped video on it. Looking around, I could see the catering facilities, namely a vending machine and a microwave. The general look of the reception/lounge was that of the big brother house on a very, very tight budget. Walking through to my room through tired looking corridors, past the WTC's security office, the lighting changed to an eerie green glow. A very odd look for public parts of the hotel. The lighting couldn't be more different to the room, I opened the door to find a red light above my head and a "bed pod" thing in the centre of the room. Think Ikea does young offenders institution. Integral to this bed pod were a set of LED lights that do interesting colour chasing programmes. Not top of my list for hotel lighting, I'd rather a little sunlight. To my surprise, the shower room was integral to the bed pod. My toilet was about 6 inches away from my pillow and there was no door seperating them. Before taking a poo, I decided it would be prudent to open a window. No such luck. All the windows in this cell were sealed shut. I decided to look out of the window, so stood atop my bed to see over the frosted part of the glazing. And what a view! The bins in the parking garage before me were parked pleasingly straight. Sadly, even after turning of the disco lights, my sleep was not sound as what seemed like the entire hotel's drainage system seems to be plumbed directly into my pod. Still, at least I was reassured that my fellow inmates were a clean bunch, what with the sound of their showers and toilet breaks keeping me entertained throughout the night. My room did not have the luxury of a desk, which I'm told other rooms are afforded.

Reviews.Title: “Qbic Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: bella210205
Reviews.Content: Qbic is the first stop on the train from Schipol airport. Gent on reception was very pleasant and helpful. Check in was 3pm and he allowed us to check in before 12pm which was great. Hotel was good value for money and clean (compared to what you would have got in the city for your money). Tram 5 stopped just behind the hotel and took approx 25 mins to get into centre but least you got to see the sights on the way. Metro 51 took around 10 mins but you didn't see as much. I have no complaints re this hotel and would stay here again and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “funky design budgethotel, but watch the terms”
Reviews.Author: Niels66
Reviews.Content: interesting formula: funky design budgethotel in WTC Amsterdam; truly friendly staff and breakfast included largely makes up for lack of fresh air due to sealed windows or no windows at all in your room; price/quality seems fine, but if you decide to stay shorter than the number of nights reserved, you still pay the whole amount: no refund alas!

Reviews.Title: “cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: hcbrads
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel last weekend and had a very good time. Although the world trade centre is a bit outside the main centre, it's pretty easy to use the public transport as it's 2mins from Amsterdam south station [a 5 min journey from the airport-cost 3 euros] to get into the centre. The room was very quirky, with the open-plan bathroom an interesting experience! breakfast was very good too. would recommend this place if you want to stay away from the main drag.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Tauranga, Bay Of Plenty, New Zealand
Reviews.Title: “Good idea poorly executed”
Reviews.Author: Biglobb
Reviews.Content: On arrival the room had a slight smell of urine about it.. perhaps the fact the shower / toilet cubicle does not have a door on it has something to do with it. Fantastic decorated rooms and makes excellent use of the space.. Not a bad place for a night or two, but I was there for 5 nights and was a bit too much. Cleaning was not that great, and a noisy corridor at times. Staff seemed nice and breakfast pretty standard for a Euro hotel. Excellent location to the train and tram. Lights did not work in my room.. so had a red glow for most of the time. Needs some work and could be an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor staff on telephone”
Reviews.Author: F C
Reviews.Content: Before booking this hotel I rang the hotel to enquire if a cot was available. I was assured that a cot would be available and I should carry on with the booking and email QBIC for a cot. I booked online and was later informed(next day) no cot was available and that I could not have a refund. This is appalling customer service seeing as i phoned the hotel before proceeding with the booking. I was promised a bigger bed for the baby but this didn't happen either. On the plus the location is excellent. The room was dirty with stains on the wall and door and accumulated dust. I would not recommend this hotel for a young family. Suitable for single male traveler

Reviews.Title: “Staff and cleanliness leave a LOT to be desired”
Reviews.Author: guerillakitchen
Reviews.Content: The standard of cleaning in the room was appalling as you will see from the photo - I doubt the underside of the bed has ever been cleaned - there were balls of dust behind the kickboard. The mirror, television, lamps, side of bed and skirting boards were also covered in dust so thick it could be written in. As a respite from the room, my partner and I decided to buy some tea and watch TV in the lobby. The host /concierge complained that he had been watching the football and asked us to switch back to the channel he preferred. At breakfast, he and a colleague had a very loud conversation, practically shouting across the room. His female colleague was so rude to two female guests I almost intervened. The location, room and design and cost are great but staff and cleaning leave a great deal to be desired. I'm use d to' a hotel being run for the convenience of the guests - not the staff as it appeared to be at Qbic. I've rated below but actually if the staff and cleaning were improved the rooms could rate as Very Good or Excellent

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased, will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: RoadtripperPeter
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 day stay at the hotel. Very handy for the RAI and only a 10 minute walk through Beatrix Park to get to the back of the Beach at the exhibition centre. Super handy for the Metro or Rail Link should you want to arrive from Schipol or go to Centraal Station. If you want to eat close there is a Wagamama's 2 minutes away Rooms are slightly quirky, but very stylish and comfortable. My only wish would be for a better desk/chair to work from. Slight wifi hiccup on the first day but that seemed to fix itself. The staff could not have been more helpful, they were always willing to give advice, book taxis etc. Value for money is a tricky one as all Amsterdam hotels put their prices up when there is a big exhibition on.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Value”
Reviews.Author: RitchieKurniawan
Reviews.Content: Great location.. zuid station is in next station after schiphol railway station. The hotel is easy to find. Just ask to the reception of WTC. The bed is ok. The staff is great. The only things bother me is the bathroom. It's in the bedroom (literally!!). No door that separate the bedroom and the bathroom. The smell of your poo will spread to all over bedroom. Less hygienic. Kindly consider it! Overall is ok.

Reviews.Title: “A poor man's version of CitizenM”
Reviews.Author: SlPoppy
Reviews.Content: While the staff were friendly, there were quite intrusive. We had knocks on our door at 4.14am when we were sleeping with the tv on to see if we were smoking in the room and then a knock first thing in the morning for the same reason when we didn't smoke in the room once. While there was nothing wrong with the hotel, apart from the fact that the bed isn't that comfortable, and the hotel is incredibly difficult to find, having stayed in the nearvy CitizenM last year, I could only recommend that you pay the extra 50â‚¬ and stay in CitizenM. Having thought I was being a savvy traveller by going for the cheaper yet similar hotel, I have learned that the quality of room and service you get for an extra 50â‚¬ is well worth the extra little bit of money. Quite a freaky hotel (the corridors are creepy at night-time once you've had a drink or two), and quite uncomfortable. Would honestly recommend CitizenM and not Qbic.

Reviews.Title: “We had a nice trip”
Reviews.Author: Christophe J
Reviews.Content: The room was great, we loved the lights but we missed a door for the bathroom... And it was also disturbing that the light of the bathroom would turn off while we were in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and stylish”
Reviews.Author: Rachael H
Reviews.Content: This is the strangest and coolest hotel room i've ever stayed in. It's definately one to share with someone you are very comfortable with as there is no door to the bathroom and the shower wall is see-through. Bed is massive and very comfy. The decoration and the neon lights were definately the best feature though. There is practically no wardrobe though, it's best to keep your things in your suitcase and our view was of building wall. Whilst the room is incredible, I wouldn't like to stay there for most than 3 nights as it could end up feeling claustrophobic, its not really a room to spend a lot of time in. The lobby should be bigger as breakfast was crowded and it wasn't really a place to hang out. Red carpet to the entrance to the hotel was a really nice touch. Location was ok, but if we wanted to go anywhere we had to get a train, metro or taxi, which was a bit annoying. However this was a fantastic hotel for a weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “Experimentation can sometimes be dangerous”
Reviews.Author: AnujkAgarwal
Reviews.Content: A business traveller cannot desire for more... Step out ouf the room and you are into business. The Hotel is located right inside the WTC building. The other high is the convenience of transportation. Within 2 minutes of walk, you can access the Airport Train, the Train services, the Metro, Tram and the buses. The journey in airport train to Schipol is less than 10 minutes. The Hotel staff is very warm in approach, despite managing a 'complex' infrastructure. May be, thats what makes the hotel clicking....We were lucky to get a room with a Window ! That makes things better. There is little for entertainment in the hotel. Even the small television screen in the room has been placed high near the bed which makes it very inconvenient. The Hotel definitely needs to come up with an innovative solution to fix the Toilet issue. It will really help them.. we are unaware of the reasons for this complicated infrastructure design, but making the toilets in a conventional manner would be really useful.

Reviews.Title: “Very good lau for for money”
Reviews.Author: Yve_B196562
Reviews.Content: Good situation, except not very easy to be found, the rooms are clean and well equipped and the hotel is very quiet. I recommand if you are looking for a cheap clean hotel with free wee-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value, brilliant hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Harriet H
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for three nights from the 21-24 August. The hotel was brilliant, the reception area was modern and well decorated with a free to use computer as well as vending machines selling snacks and drinks. The staff were very helpful and let us borrow plates and cutlery for food we had bought. We arrived about half an hour before the 3pm check-in time but they let us check-in early. The hotel is easy to reach from the airport, about a ten minute train ride to Amsterdam Zuid station which is opposite the hotel. It was about 15 minutes to Centraal Station on the number 5 tram which stops about a 2 minute walk from the hotel, which was very handy. The room itself was well lit from a large window, well decorated and clean. Our towels were changed every day and the bed was made every day too. There were a few scratches on the walls and the metal wall/'casing' of the bed was ever so slightly in need of a wash, but the bed itself as well as the bathroom and other surfaces were all clean. The shower(s) was hot and powerful. The lack of bathroom door was not an issue, there are toilets located on every floor. Overall, a brilliant hotel which I would mainly recommend to couples and friends travelling together. Thank you Qbic for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “CHANGE CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: Leo L
Reviews.Content: far from the center,without free park,room without window,bathroom without door,cold hotel inside a busisness building so,there's nobody during the night outside the hotel and the street near the hotel are really dark. CHANGE CHOICE.

Reviews.Title: “very funky, would definately stay again!”
Reviews.Author: FozzL3
Reviews.Content: Great place, clean with modern facilities and an awesome shower. Close to public transport links, which took you into the heart of Amsterdam within 15 minutes. The world trade centre had some lovely bars and restaurants, but these are only open Monday to Friday. Overall stay was enjoyable and we would definately book here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: ST1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a girls weekend Aug 2011. The hotel was perfectly located - far enough away from the hussle and bussle of the city centre but close enough to just jump on a tram and be there in 15 mins. Rooms are basic but perfect for a weekend. The bed was super comfortable and the mood lighting is a funky twist. The hotel lobby has an iMac computer which has iTunes loaded on to it so it was a great place to start our nights out. If I was staying here while on business (location is within the business district) I'm not sure it would be comortable enough but it's ideal for a weekend away. Would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Staff were lovely,room was perfect”
Reviews.Author: Gemmnix
Reviews.Content: Would defiantly recommend & stay here again,red carpet on arrival,staff are so helpful & friendly.The rooms are spacious,modern,clean & funky.Only 5 mins away from airport & 15 mins to centre,ideal for us we loved getting back to our Cosy hotel after long days & nights out,thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: Marius K
Reviews.Content: We were greeted very friendly and didnt have to wait to get our room key card. Everything we booked was perfect and the check in was easy. The room was as it was described. We had a huge bed, nice bathroom (without doors), a TV, a safe and a table Also, W LAN is provided. Everything was clean, soap and shower gel was provided. There arent any windows though. This didn't turn out to be uncomfortable because we stayed one night only. The set up is very modern and the light is adjustable (green, blue, clean). It is very easy to find your way into the city. Definitely a good opportunity for young people having a one night stay!

Reviews.Title: “Qbic it's quick”
Reviews.Author: Lady-Do1phin
Reviews.Content: The Qbic is a fun, clean, modern hotel to stay. It is about 15mins from the center of Amsterdam on Tram number 5 and the station is just oustide. It is attached/part of the WTC and in a business area so at lunch time etc it is full of office workers. The beds are comfy and the hotel staff very helpful. There is no storage space in the room but most guests seem to be there for a couple of nights so living out of a case is ok. The art work in the rooms and the lights on the bed are funky and the hotel is quiet. The bathroom is round the back of the bed but not having a bathroom door is not an issue because unless you walk around to the bathroom you can't actually see the person in the bathroom, the only disadvantage of not having a door is It that any unpleasant smells soon waft around the room :-( The room we had first did not have a window so we moved the following day to a room with a window. If you are looking for something a little quirky, away from the centre that is quiet and clean with great staff then I would recommend the Qbic.

Reviews.Title: “Original and confortable”
Reviews.Author: CatarinaLiquito
Reviews.Content: Different hotel, a good concept. Well locate you can get there with no problems and go easly to the centre. Staff nice and helpfull. Rooms are a litlle cold and you canÂ´t ajusted. Our room had windows

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toddy1971
Reviews.Content: Wow loved this hotel posh reception and well smart rooms. The receptionist was so helpful and let us check in at 10am as our flight was early morning. Our room was on the 3rd floor and you felt safe as you had to use your room key to get through the lobby doors, once in our room it was very smart with a red chair blue lights lighting up the bed and cool wall paper. We were a bit concerned about the bathroom not having a door but all we did was put the tv on and the shower if we needed to use the loo. With the hotel being near the business district it was a quiet night so no loud drinkers, was easy to get into the town as the number 5 tram goes straight to central station. I would highly recommend this hotel it's clean and has all you need in a hotel room

Reviews.Title: “Very good Price performance ratio”
Reviews.Author: Daniela207182
Reviews.Content: Beautiful large rooms and luxurious buffet's breakfast Courteous and friendly staff With about 20 minutes by metro to the center The only drawback: no door to the bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: marmite77
Reviews.Content: Interesting, fun hotel in great location, two minutes from train / metro station and just round the corner from tram stop, from which trams go to museum district and main train station. I stayed here to see a show at the Amsterdam Arena, as there is a metro train directly from the station, and felt fairly safe walking the short distance from the train station to the hotel alone late at night. Friendly staff, who speak English. Rooms really quirky and different from the norm - corridor outside my room had green lighting and actual room, when entering, had red lighting (although you can change this), making it feel a little like a theme park. There was no window so when the lights were turned off it was pitch black, which allowed me a great night's sleep! Turning on the lights in the morning, having the soft, different coloured lights working through their sequence was a gentle way to wake up too. Room quite minimalistic, with just a bench table and a couple of stools at the end of your bed (and the TV above), so was not really sure where you're supposed to put things but was not staying long so was not a problem. You step up into the bathroom so it kindof feels like you are on a stage. As stated by others, the bathroom has no door, which is a little strange but fine if you're in the room alone!

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels we've stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: MrGLG
Reviews.Content: Easy transport to/from Schiphol and Amsterdam town. Nice quiet business area to stay in with nice coffee shops in local vicinity. Right next door to Amsterdam Zuid station. Tram #5 (from behind WTC) or #51 (from inside the station) to Amsterdam Central. Make use of the mini cards at the hotel to save a little money around the attractions. Ask the staff if you need information because they were fantastic and so helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Probinson50
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay. 2mins from train station. Would def stay again. The beds are funky

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, quirky hotel”
Reviews.Author: nickmay
Reviews.Content: A great hotel just 15 minutes tram ride from the squares and about the same from the airport. Friendly staff, clean rooms, funky lighting in the rooms as well which you can control. Great for a weekend stay

Reviews.Title: “It's almost 100% !!!”
Reviews.Author: Dolphinyong
Reviews.Content: Cozy and stylish room and lobby with free wifi which is fast as I consider it to be. It's just about 10 minutes from the airport by train and the metro,tram and bus station is just about 200 metres away. So, there were no problem for us to get to all the attraction in Amsterdam. Staff were friendly and very helpful. We had an almost perfect 2nights stay. The only negative point is that, the bathroom has no door, I would recommend a curtain at lest if not a door for the bathroom, making it suitable for friends and family. Overall excellent hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “great concept but a little bit clostrphobic”
Reviews.Author: marco_atk85
Reviews.Content: + easy to acces to the city center +friendly staff + great concept + value for the money comparing amsterdam hotel prices - no window means clostrophobic - 2 matress in double bed, very bad sleep experience - no door on bathroom, very annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel that gives value for the money”
Reviews.Author: stusvig
Reviews.Content: The only big drawback for us was that there is no way to close the bathroom. You really have to know your partner, because you will hear everything going on there as its just a couple of meters away. Upon arrival the bathroom was clean, but not as shiny as you would like your bathroom in a hotel to be. My girlfriend missed having a hairdryer available there. I would say the hotel is a good place to stay for couples below 40-45. Good service, nice hotel, good prices and quick and easy travel to all the places you wanna see while visiting Amsterdam. Can totally recommend the hotel if you are fine with having no bathroom door.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel but my room had no window!!!”
Reviews.Author: loujohns
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently whilst attending a conference at the RAI. The other reviews on here are all pretty accurate - good location in terms of train/metro etc, close to airport and short walk to the RAI, but not a lot around the hotel itself. Great service, really helpful. Room clean and a good size. The bathroom's are open - exactly like in the pictures on the website, so if this is a problem for you - don't book! I was travelling alone so it was fine. The one MAJOR drawback for me was that my room didn't have a window, so it felt like I was staying in a box. Even just spending an hour or so during the day in a room with absolutely no natural light was claustraphobic and opressive. And you can't even see what the weather is doing to know what to wear in the morning! Also, becasue of the funky lighting, doing any kind of work/reading in the room was difficult. I have never before stayed in a hotel room with no window - even for a budget hotel I think this is a basic requirement. For this reason, I probably wouldn't stay again. I'm surprised that others haven't mentioned this in their reviews - so wonder if I was just unlucky with my room?

Reviews.Title: “I liked it. my wife did not like it!”
Reviews.Author: cdn1967
Reviews.Content: location superb. train and metro and tram one minute away. staff very very good and helpfull . room big. wifi free and working great. safe was provided in the room. good! bed confortable. bathroom no door! but we knew it from the true pictures on the web site. shower ok. price: average. overall I have liked it, but it will NOT suit everyone. If I can I will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, in need of some small improvements!!”
Reviews.Author: Pokerlenny
Reviews.Content: Great Idea "Qbic" great lightning concept. Being in a double room we missed a door to the Bath, some things in life you don't want to share :-). The last cleaning behind the bed was done a long long time ago!! Great are the public transportation connection just outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The worst experience”
Reviews.Author: Nacho23101974
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at your hotel in the morning of the 30th of May, the first words I heard from the only staff guy I could find (at the kitchen) were "IÂ´m to busy now". My wife did not feel quite well that morning so I tried to insist getting a " I told you IÂ´m busy. Checking time is not until 3 oÂ´clock is clearly said''. IÂ´ve never been treated that way and if I did not leave the hotel was only because my wife was not in good conditions to move around with the lugagge looking for another hotel. The cleaning service could be considered at the same level as the staff attitude Important remarks: No closing room at the bathroom so you need to be very familiar with your couple. Definetly, not recommended for recent couples.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced box”
Reviews.Author: Swiftspear
Reviews.Content: Minimally staffed tired looking dormitory. Poor lighting in room, no window. Everything looks worn and tired.

Reviews.Title: “great place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: chili22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is next to the train stations that will go to down town in not more than 15 min. ithe room was clean but don't expect luxuary it was a quiet area and people there are very nice and helpful. There were a couple of little resturants around the corner. all in all i would stay there again by the way price was right! thanks qbic eva

Reviews.Title: “Some drawbacks but overall a great place to stay:-)”
Reviews.Author: PaxRyan
Reviews.Content: The service here was incredibly helpful. It seemed the concept behind this concept hotel was simplicity, and in fact nearly everything in the lobby was self service. But there seemed to always be someone there working as well and all the employees we encountered were perfectly competent and very helpful. And the location was better than it seems to be - subway and busses within 20yards of the hotel connect easily to downtown Amsterdam within about 15 or 20minutes of travel. Which is good though because there seemed to be pretty much nothing around near the hotel. The one big drawback i can imagine a lot of people having (aside from not actually being downtown in the center) is the bathroom area of each room is not closed off from the rest of the room at all. The toilet is in your bathroom. Wasn't a big deal with me as i was traveling with a physical intimate date, but with just friends this would have really sucked. The free wifi internet was very helpful too:-)

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: David117
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night and it cost us 150 euros. The room is small, no desk, and not that clean. The bed is too floppy and it is almost getting into the bottom of the bed when lying on it. The light in the room is really dim, and the toilet has no door so that the water easily splashed outside when having shower. However, it is easy to get access to the public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service but feels more like a dormitory than a hotel”
Reviews.Author: DoonLoomden
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights as the other hotel I stayed in during my trip (CitizenM) was unavailable. After arrviing from a long haul flight on a Saturday, there was an obvious lack of amenities near by (Burger King in Zuid Staion). Breakfast buffet was small but decent, and the staff provided excellent service, however it does kind of fall flat as a hotel. The room is quite small, but the bed is comfortable - I ended up with the infamous 203 room where the only mood lighting color you get is Blue. There were no full size towels in my room the first day, but was corrected afterwards. The lounge area is quite small and during the weekend you had to card scan your way into the building. The shower was alright but as a tall stocky man, a sliding glass door for the shower would be better than a half divider to minimize water invading the other parts of the bathroom. The weather got cold during the stay and the room became freezing! Luckily the warm comforter and soft bed helped stay warm.The walls were quite thin and could frequently hear the people in the room next to me (who were an older couple.. not party animals lol). Kind of almost had more of a hostel feel than a hotel feel - I thought it was a so-so experience, until i checked into my 2nd hotel at Citizen M and then that downgraded my experienceat Qbic further as both cost similarly but I felt a much better experience was had at the other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, far from City Center though.”
Reviews.Author: AxelleP
Reviews.Content: My friends and I booked this hotel for 2 nights; I shared the room with a close friend (we were both girls). The room was smaller than expected, however the pictures published on the hotel website stay true, design-wise (ambient lighting sans the Hastens bed!). Do not expect a roomy space for your luggages and whatnots. A secure closet is not provided, only a tiny shelf where you can place your immediate accessories and hang a piece or two of clothing. Not much hooks/hangers too for stuff you want to hang. No full-length mirror provided as well. The bathroom didn't have a door! So my friend and I had to take careful turns to avoid any vulnerable instances... I guess this room would be perfect for lovers/ couples ;P They didn't have a phone in the room. However, free wifi connection is provided hence Facetime/Skype is accessible. Also, they only had central control for the room airconditioning so we couldn't adjust the thermostat ourselves. The staff however was thoughtful to have brought a portable air heater to regulate the temperature in the room. Hotel was near the Amsterdam Zuid train station and two blocks away from Princess Irene tram station. We preferred taking the tram so it was kind of a pain for us to go back and forth the hotel if we've left something in the room. We were on budget and was hoping to have access to local bakeries/ food shops for breakfast, but there was none nearby. We didn't have a choice but to get the hotel breakfast on our first day. Service was great, and the staff was very helpful and attentive. It's funny when we were trying to figure out our location via a map, a local went up to us and asked if we needed help cos we seemed lost and said that this area is not where tourists usually go to! The tram system however was efficient enough for us to cope with the location problem. All in all, I'd say you get what you pay for here. Rates are reasonable, good service, clean rooms, but not without a few quirks.

Reviews.Title: “You feel like you are living in central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: robs_bergen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel which is a very mordern design. Colorful room (you can change the color of the light in the room). of course there was no doors in bathroom but it didnot bothered us. Even though one is living out of city central but the distance to the tram station and the metro station make you feel that you are living in the central. And from Schipol airport it is just the second station and is just cost approx 3 euros for one way ticket.. We would of course prefer this hotel if we will go to amsterdam...

Reviews.Title: “If Apple designed a hotel room”
Reviews.Author: tysonbeckford10
Reviews.Content: Positives: Friendly & helpful staff; excellent value for budget & mid-level travelers; cool room design; great bathroom with FANTASTIC shower-head; excellent proximity to Amsterdam Zuid station, mini grocery store & postal center; free Wifi; short train ride from Schipol. Negatives: Although there was fresh linen and the room was quite clean. There could have been more attention to detail. The floor wasn't very well swept; there were scuff marks on the wall next to the bed; there was hair (head & pubic) on my duvet cover (a friend suggested to me that they may have been picked up from the floor when the bed was being made); there were food and drink stains on the counter railings. The rooms have windows that can't be opened- if they have windows- and no in-room climate control. I am glad I was on my own because bathroom smells and mugginess would have made it a little uncomfortable. To get some air flow I would prop my door open. Although it is close to Zuid Station it is a slightly inconvenient distance from Amsterdam Central Station. I didn't have the breakfast, but it definitely didn't look like it was worth 10 Euros. Save yourself 8 Euros and grab a croissant and a juice at the store around the corner. The windows and location obviously can't be changed, but I marked it down because of the not up to 'hotel-par' cleanliness. Budget, doesn't mean it can't be spic and span.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, bad hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mandm5_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed hear in July of last year for first holiday. In booking the hotel we follwed the advice of reading reviews of trip advisor and other similar websites and never found any negative, just everyone stating it was a modern, funky hotel, so we went for it. On arriving staff were very friendly, cannot remember the mans name but is was mostly a male on all the time and he was very friendly and helpful, could not fault him. Helped us out with finding best attractions, tram tickets etc.Hotel first off is decieving on websites and is actually alot smaller in reception and room in real life, but this would not have been a problem to us. We were given our room and found it hilarious with changing lights, no shower or toilet door and were generally happy and amused.Problems were, our window looked into the buildings waste disposal and collection yard, not the most pleasing sight so we kept this closed which left room very dark. At 5ish in morning on 1-2 occasions, people started working in this yard with heavey machinary, making us and meaning we were unable to sleep. Another night i heard banging like a release of pressure from the toilet, it kept hapening so my boyfriend went and looked anf i had seemed the toilet had backfired as there was water all over bathroom floor and toilet. Again, another night, an alarm went off in hotel which continued for about an hour, seemed like a fire alarm, with a siren and then a message in a fe different languages, like attention, attention, please leave the building. So, overall we didn't get much sleep. We didn't want to complain at recpetion as the man in charge had been so helpful and this was not his fault. Also, despite this, we had a fantastic holiday. We took the view we were only in the room at night and not to let it ruin our experience but would definatly not reccomend this hotel for anyone else unless they were garunteed no to get the room with the view of the industrial yard!!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing experience-enjoyed the stay...”
Reviews.Author: M9shy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a block of what looked like business properties once inside very contemporary and modern. Bedrooms were beautiful and well looked after. We arrived left our luggage and went sight seeing. The metro and buses were minutes away. Very accessible to get to centre and to and from the airport. I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would recomment it to other travellers. I would stay there again. Room equipted with t.v. not sure if wifi was working. Few eating places near by and cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Cool :)”
Reviews.Author: GerPowell
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Qbic. The room was really cool and ideal for a short stay. The only negative thing was the bathroom with no door but we managed to live with that too. It could be a bit of a hassle if you are really not comfortable with the people you are travelling with but if not, it's no problem at all! Breakfast was also good and abundant for the price! Furthermore even though the location is not central, you can easily catch a tram which is 2 minutes away! All in all we really enjoyed our stay at Qbic and I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice "design" concept, great bed and good service.”
Reviews.Author: koortep
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean and have all necessaries. Service is good and check-in/out is fast. When sun is strong, rooms can be warm since airco is centrally managed and windows can't open. However during our stay this was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “That is really good for a rest.”
Reviews.Author: Miazyy
Reviews.Content: The room is very quiet and good for sleep, but that is a little dark in the room because there is no windows in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Cool lights”
Reviews.Author: Celt13
Reviews.Content: First off the staff were nice, bit strange as on arrival no one was there so used a phone and someone soon appeared. Room feels 70/80's space age (old iPhone 3 inspired). Great bed with lovely lighting if your have some fun in it :-). The toilet should have a door though as I would like to protect my partner from certain smells and sounds. Good location for train back to airport and its quiet. Thanks qbic.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: susannegraydon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just come back from a very enjoyable stay in Amsterdam. The hotel was clean, cool and the staff ver friendly. Ten minutes on the train from the airport and you're there and only $6 for two people. The hotel is just outside the station and the tram runs at the other side of the hotel. 15 minutes takes you into central for $5 for two people.

Reviews.Title: “nice concept, but the details”
Reviews.Author: Cybersky
Reviews.Content: room is in ipod/apple style, nice to have for 1 night, but no longer, here is why: (room 114) A) shower water runs into living room (approx. 0,5 liter per shower) , you need one towel to build up an barrier B) toiletts without a door !! (for alone its ok, but if you travel with a partner a bit more privacy is required, you feel like in a jail, also due to very small room and ... C) no WINDOWS :-) your "Cabin" is inside in the middle of a parking garage. (believe it or not) in our special case, WLAN was temporarily out of order. but no hint or information about that (room has no reception phone line) so I wasted one hour to find the error in my notebook. But next day the very nice receptionist gave me 2 coffee for free and the parking (which is otherwise expensive) also for free, so service was fair. if you travel over weekend, the WTC (World Trade Center) is without any people and the way from parking place to your room is scary and lonely. all doors closed, you need to talk with an operator to open the (4) doors one way. if you like Thrillers, its perfect, other people feel save in such athmosphere, I feel scared :-) room itself is trendy/stylish/modern with LED light, its clean but its only for 1 night., You even have no wardrobe ;-) During check in , ask for a 2nd key (if you travel with a partner) cause there is another closed door on the way to your room. By the way: avoid artis zoo in amsterdam (outdated and more a museum, than a modern zoo). Take the 100 spectactles boat trip (1 hour, 13 Euro)

Reviews.Title: “best choice”
Reviews.Author: Yldegonda
Reviews.Content: I was very happy to choose this hotel. Staff was very nice and helpful. The hotel is very easy to reach, it's near to the airport and with only a few minutes you can reach the city centre. In addition the hotel is next to the station, but it is very quite at the same time. We were satisfied with breakfast as well. The hotel is clean, our room was very special and beautiful, and I liked it very much. Although it was a little bit cold for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fran770
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of the World Trade Centre complex, which I thought might be a bit out of the way. It wasn't at all - one quick train ride from the airport and regular trams into the centre of town. Amsterdam transport is reliable and often so travel to and from the hotel is very easy. A taxi home at night was only â‚¬10. We found it strange having to check yourself in, but are now completely sold on this laid back self service style. When we came in to contact with staff we found them friendly and helpful. The rooms are everything you need - comfy large bed and a simple contemporary design. I would definitely recommend this hotel above other shabby central ones.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: MitchAllan89
Reviews.Content: The location is great, especailly for those that don't want to stay within the very centre of Amsterdam. It's within sight of the Train/Metro station meaning you can at Centraal Station within 20 minutes from leaving your room door, it's also just one train stop. The room was clean enough, not spotless but as clean as anyonce would reasonably expect. As were the communal areas which were clean and full of modern seating and living furniture. Free Wi-Fi, really helpful and polite staff, great surroundings in the room and lobby areas and the most comfortable seat know to man are some great points of this hotel. Bit of a flaw as others have mentioned there is no control over the temperature of the room, big office block style windows and no air circulation makes for a warm room, even just on a warm April day. I wouldn't want to feel what it's like on a hot summers day.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel with a couple drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Stodds73
Reviews.Content: I really liked the hotel, the room was very cool and it was clean. The price for Amsterdam was very good for what you got, a lot of other places in Amsterdam are more money for a lot less. That being said, it was far from the main parts of town, and although it was close to the metro, the location was still a major drawback. The other thing was that we were one of the unlucky people to got a room without a window, which made it feel like a cave at times, and hard to dress for the day. Overall I would stay here again but not without looking at other places first.

Reviews.Title: “How could a room with mood lighting be anything but awesome?”
Reviews.Author: pammygfunk
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Amsterdam Qbic for three nights, and it was fantastic. It was just steps away from the Zuid station, easily accessible by both metro and tram. The room was super cool with adjustable mood lighting in a multitude of colors. The staff was very nice and helpful and the room was clean. The second day, the cleaning staff must have gotten distracted halfway through cleaning our room because the bed was not made (not a big deal) and, while they replaced the towels, they only gave us one bath towel (a bit more of a problem). The guests did not have control over the temperature, at least not that we could figure out, so the room was a little toasty. Overall, we loved the hotel and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Funky decor, right beside convenient public transportation, clean and well-organised, and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Bruce060
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended. This super-modern hotel is right beside the train station, a tram stop, and the Metro, all taking you into the centre of the city within 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kiwitraveller1983
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Qbic hotel with my boyfriend for 2 nights and we really enjoyed it. It certainly is a unique and funky concept-the staff that work there are super friendly and were very helpful with recommendations on restaurants and transportation. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to the tram, bus, rail and metro so it is really well connected even if it is not in the central area of town (we got a 48hour travel card for 11.50 euro each which was perfect for us). Breakfast was simple but adequate with croissants, pastries, fruit, cereal, rolls, yoghurts and the best was the chocolate sprinkle!! The lack of window in the room (window was frosted over with blinds) wasn't too much of an issue for us although I don't know if I could stay there much longer than a few nights (we were out and about heaps anyway so didn't spend much time in the room). My only negative comment was the noise we experienced on the Monday morning-our room was next to a carpark and loading dock so at 7am we were woken by this and then we could also hear office workers walking around in the area which is joined to the hotel (WTC) so we did not get as good a sleep as we would have liked on our second night but the first night (Saturday night) was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but silly thigs spoilt it.”
Reviews.Author: RobWedekind
Reviews.Content: Good: Interior is nice, corridors well decked out, rooms well furnished and modern. Free wifi internet is a plus. Terrible: 1. Room is freezing cold, no temperature control to change the icy air conditioning. 2. Have to sit in darkness with the curtains drawn. The hotel has removed the blinds from the windows and there is a bench right outside facing my window, 4 metres away. Two totally obvious problems that have spolt it.

Reviews.Title: “modern self-serve hotel concept, comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: VancouverIslandBoots
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Qbic for 2 nights in Sept 2011. The hotel is in the International Trade Centre which is easily accessible from Amsterdam Central Station via the Tram, about 15 minutes. If you arrive late at night the hotel entrance is on the back side of the building and you have to walk around the outside, during the day you may enter through the Trade Centre. The room is a box with a cube in the center which contains the bed, washroom and a bar type seating area. The room was clean and quiet, the bed was very comfortable. Everything that we needed to rest our tired feet and recover from jetlag. Breakfast facilities nearby are mostly the coffee shops in the Trade Centre so bring your evening snacks, beverages and breakfast supplies with you when you leave Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “It was as I expected :-) Very colourful rooms and very friendly people! Just loved it and will go back definetly :-)”
Reviews.Author: daphneke_85
Reviews.Content: There is a free parkingspace near the hotel, 2 min walk :-) So you don't have to pay a lot for parking your car!!!! Very easy to take the bus/railway it's just behind the corner and in 5 min you reach the centre :-) Everything was perfect :-) I'm a very happy client ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a good nights kip in Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: Dovertraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Qbic hotel while last week whilst I was on a budget holiday and liked the experience very much. Although this is a big hotel that can accommodate a lot of people with a self check in, the staff were readily available for help. I arrived sometime in the morning and check in wasn't until the afternoon but a member of staff went and found me a room. I had such a good nights sleep here that I overslept and the following morning woke to a knock. I had overslept by 30 minutes but a member of staff was very cool about it and actually asked me how much longer I needed! (with no extra charge). Qbic may seem somewhat out the way from the city centre but as Amsterdam is relatively small it wasn't too much of a problem and actually would be a plus if you want somewhere relatively quiet to sleep being away from the noise of the city. This is definitely a hip hotel and nicely and cooly designed but also would imagine that a lot of their clientele are business types, being located in the WTC and I encountered a lot of people in the daytime who where going to and from work, whilst I was going to and from the Q bic hotel. I didn't find the fact that my room didn't have a window a problem, I would imagine that there is some sort of ventilation in the building. I thought the place had an air of sophistication about it and made me feel important staying there (lol). A great nights kip for Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Chic!”
Reviews.Author: KarinHunt
Reviews.Content: At the start of the month my boyfriend and I booked a last minute trip to Amsterdam. We only stayed in Amsterdam for 3 nights so we went with something fairly reasonable which was not too far from central Amsterdam. The Qbic was easy to locate, right near the World Trade Center. With a Metro line within a 2 minute walk it's so easy to get into central, it's approx 7 stops on the 51 train, which takes about 15-20 minutes and it's very easy to use and you can get a return into central for â‚¬5 or and all day travel card (which can be used on trams, metro and certain buses) for â‚¬7.
