As I drove we managed to find a P&R carpark (several are located around the outskirts of Amsterdam) which was very inexpensive for the 4 days. We arrived just before midday (check in is 3pm) but the receptionist was very helpful and managed to check us in to an available double room immediately, which was great news. When entering the room, it was a lot more spacious than what we had expected and also what you may think from photos. For the price, you can hardly fault this hotel. The room is large with a big double bed and a decent sized television. As for the bathroom, there was a large headed power shower, sink unit and toilet. The only issue is that there is no door on the bathroom, just a large entrance, which can leave you very exposed, and may cause slight embarrassment, but we thought it was fairly humorous! However, the hotel does warn you of this before you book, so it's not something that you should complain about. There was an option of changing the lighting in the room, but we couldn't figure that one out, so our room remained blue for the whole of the time we stayed, not that we minded either! Next time we will have to ask, instead of forgetting! We were put in a room without a window, which again, we didn't mind as we were only in the room during the night time. The hotel is easy to access 24 hours as your room keycard allows you access to the main front door, but there always seemed to be a member of staff up at all hours should you misplace your key, or leave it in the room! We would definitely consider coming back when returning to Amsterdam as this is a very hassle free, clean and friendly hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Different and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Emsworth89
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a really good location-there is the metro at one side of it and tram and bus stops at the other so getting to the centre is no problem at all which is great! The staff were nice and friendly, we arrived too early for check in but the woman who was there allowed us to check in early as she had some rooms available which was very nice after a long morning! Only complaint about the service is that there wasn't any room service. I thought they hadn't even been in the room but my partner pointed out we had fresh towels and new toiletries which was all very nice but they could have made the bed!! The lights in our room didn't work which wasn't the end of the world as I liked the purple but still not what we thought we were getting. I also found the rooms to be quite stuffy and incubated and was glad to get out and get some fresh air when I woke up each morning. They have well stocked vending machines in the 'living area' downstairs which is good as there are no tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms. There are also a few restaurants around and a shop as well as a burger king and shop in the train station just outside. All in all, we enjoyed our stay here-the rooms were nicely decorated and with a few tweaks it could be amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Good in parts, average in others but never bad.”
Reviews.Author: JonnyLOEF
Reviews.Content: Qbic WTC Amsterdam - Firstly the location, well it is good and bad. Only 5 minutes from the airport to Amsterdam South is pretty handy and walk out of the station and turn left and you see the Qbic. For getting onto the City it's ok, about 10minutes get's you to the Museum area and Leidesplien (the entertainment area bars bars bars), a further 5 minutes gets you to Dam square which is the gateway to more bars, restaurants, smoking, red light ect. The tram line is about a 1 minute walk from the hotel. The rooms - The whole toilet thing bugged me, they need to purchase doors badly or some sort of screen as it feels uncomfortable poohing with no door and the worst thing is if someone enters the room you on the toilet is the first sight they see. The bed is mighty big and can be done up for two people when requested (although they didn't do this for us). The room is quite spacious and they do like to think outside the box which isint that bad. The mood lights are certainly not as bright as those in the picture and arent annoying, they are different nice. The biggest problem was the heat in the room - the hotel cant adjust the heat and you cant open the windows. I found the staff very helpful and got us a room at 1.45pm, as we had explained that due to delays and getting on wrong trains we had been 8 hours travelling (only 1hr by plane), the usual check in is 3pm. Whilst they have no bar or day time food services there are 2 well stocked vending machines with beer, crisps, potnoodles, soup and toothpaste. Just a quick word of warning - when you try a space cake and get the munchies and get home and get a pot noddle it costs a further â‚¬3 for the hot water for the pot noodle. A few people have also said there is noting around here but in the train station there is a burger king, coffee shop and newsagents and on weekdays there is 2 or 3 food places around the WTC and what looked like a bar also. I liked the hotel and would recommend it with prior warning on the heat issue and toilet situation. Get a toilet door, air con or allow windows to open, provide a few more services in the hotel (btw the internet is free) and I reckon you would move to top 30 in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Define room service please”
Reviews.Author: limaunipis
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights. Worst experience ever, the staff during check in was really unfriendly. We went out and our room was not cleaned at all! Imagine our shock that the room was as we left in the morning, except for just the change of towels. For the price that we paid, even though we are on budget, we expect the room to be make up! If there is no room service, we would rather check in a hostel rather than a hotel. We just bear with the hotel because of the convenient location. The redeeming features (that I do not give one star) was because of this one very helpful staff who answers our questions about Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, would stay again and recommend”
Reviews.Author: Elizabethrachael22
Reviews.Content: After endless searching for a decent hotel in Amsterdam due to my picky boyfriend I chose qbic because of the positive views it's received and wasn't disappointed at all! The hotel is really modern, nice self service reception an the rooms were a decent size, even the corridors were nice! I'm an art student so I really liked they lay out of the room as it's not like anything ive seen before! The bathroom doesn't have a door but it didn't bother us one bit, the shower was nice and powerful and thats all i really care about. The hotel is a bit out of the way but for the price and standard you really can't complain as you wouldnt find anything Half as decent in the city, the location surrounding the hotel is great. There's a tram, bus, metro and train station which all take you to the centre (all located on the doorstep) and a little supermarket in the square too! The only critism I have is the window situation, fair enough there's no window (I got over that as soon a I saw the creative stencil sprays) but serrrrriously you have to do something about that air con! We got so hot everynight, you would find a decent air con in any 3* hotel abroad so I don't understand why this hasn't been improved especially as there's no window, But aside from that I would happily go back to this hotel within a heartbeat, I really enjoyed my stay

Reviews.Title: “very unpleasant staff, must leave the room at eleven instead of twelve, and not 11h01 or the staff agress you, she knocked at th”
Reviews.Author: littleturtle46
Reviews.Content: no service at all, no bar or minibar, not too far center town, only the design can be interesting, and very bad staff!!! expensive for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lespotter
Reviews.Content: Hotel easy to get to from metor about 20/30 mins from centraal station. Staff very helpful and polite with excellent english

Reviews.Title: “Convenient position,”
Reviews.Author: obiwan055
Reviews.Content: PROS: Position: easy to reach from the airport, well connected with the city center Staff: kind and helpful Bed is comfortable CONS: Bed access is only from one side: one person shall crawl over the other Room cleaniness is not perfect The toilet has not the door

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price”
Reviews.Author: ruudwinter
Reviews.Content: Considering the price it is perfect. New and clean rooms. Large windows (cannot open). Internet included. For me the location is perfect, close to train station, and I use a bike anyways, but others may prefer to stay within the city center. There is no refrigerator in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: stalvik
Reviews.Content: Excactly what the pictures look like. Cool modern hotel where you can set your own "mood" with the lights. Not very central but tram 5 will take you to town in about 10 min. Buy a weekend pass in the train station automats for 11 euro. We never had to wait more than 5 minutes for a tram. Staff was very nice. A couple of things I missed on the room was hair dryer, fridge and toilet brush. The hotel didn't have a locked storage to leave the bags after check out but we could leave them in the foyer.

Reviews.Title: “Very Stylish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chunte27
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in August. The hotel was very stylish and the rooms very modern and clean. The rooms had various coloured lights that you could turn off and on to suit your mood. One of the walls had a very sylish mural and the bed was very comfotable. The bathroom was clean and again, stylish, with a lovely shower. Just a word of warning - there is no door on the bathroom! The staff were friendly though we had little interaction with them. It is situated in the WTC which has various restaurants and cafes and there is a very handy supermarket 2 mins walk from the hotel. When we were there the metro was not working however the hotel is right at the station which is very handy. The tram stops right outside the hotel and is fairly frequent, takes around 15 mins to get to the centre. We chose to walk to and from the city centre which took us about 40 mins but it was a very straightforward and interesting leisurely walk! Would reccommend this hotel as it is great value for money and quiet since it is not in the centre of the city but still very accessible!

Reviews.Title: “High quality and service for a low price”
Reviews.Author: BuxArvid
Reviews.Content: Stayed there just one night but that night will be the beginning of a long relationship. The reservation via the internet was really quick and the checkin was the same. Before I knew it, I was already on my room, unpacking my suitcase. The room is very comfortable, enough power outlets, large bed, TV and most important, free WIFI! I will definitely book a new stay there coming months! A more in-depth review (in Dutch) can be found here; http://arvid.me/eXkIzH

Reviews.Title: “Good value and modern”
Reviews.Author: luv2ravel
Reviews.Content: Last minute booking, Amsterdam hotels is expensive, so to get this qbic hotel is great. Ok it's not central but there's tram and tram just by the hotel. With the same price probably you'd get a dirty old and not nice accommodation in central Amsterdam. So this hotel is very good value. It's modern, cool led lights (unfortunately ours just stay in 1 colour but didn't bother us as we're in the hotel just to sleep). Other thing is the toilet is open, so there's no privacy when one of us using it, eventhough you're couple you'd still need a privacy to seat on the wc. I can see this hotel used a lot by business people (1 in a room) as the location is in the business district, World Trade Centre. Apart from that everything is fine. Cool hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: darkpearl678
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a great stay in a clean and fancy room. The special design of the hotel does everything to make a stay at Qbic a special experience. We expected a tiny room - due to the small price - but there was really enough place for everything - ok, a hairdryer would have been nice, but one can live without...Staff was super nice and helpful and the spot of the hotel is perfect to travel quickly to Amsterdam's city centre by metro. We even could park for free! We wouldn't chose another hotel for our next stay! All recommendations!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel should be closed down”
Reviews.Author: ElstreeDV
Reviews.Content: Putting aside the fact that the staff were nice and helpful the rooms are without doubt the most tasteless, artless and unhip rooms I have ever had this miss-fortune to be booked into. Everything from the hideous open-plan toilet to the adolescent lighting made me want to find the "entrepreneurs" who thought up this nightmare and have them boiled in oil. The towels where thin. On a three night stay my room was made up once. It was impossible to open the curtains as the street (at a slightly higher level) was almost in your room. I have seen films about English prison cells which made favourable comparison with these rooms. I am well aware that young travellers need cheap and cheerful hotel rooms and that their idea of essentials may be different from an old git like me. However, this is just nasty and takes advantage of their naivety in this area, as the other revues attest.

Reviews.Title: “Low cost, good quality and very friendly staff! would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Toxic-Crow
Reviews.Content: Situated very close to Zuid station, it was a little bit difficult to find and no one that worked in the area knew where it was, but once found all was OK! 10 minutes walk to the RAI Conference Centre, 1 minute and you are on the station platform. Very funky design in the rooms, just make sure your partner doesn't open the room door whilst you are in the shower..................or worse! as there is no loo door. A lady opposite did as I left my room for breakfast, nuff said!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, Convenient & Save Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hillside_traci
Reviews.Content: Comfy room in terms of size, layout and the bed, i just don't like the bathroom design, as there is no door, easy to catch cold after shower. Extremely conventient location, 5 mins train to the airport, 1 min walk to the train station, 2 mins walk to the tram back to the city center and what other hotel can be more convenient then this. Its located inside a commercial zone, which i found it more save and quite in compare to those hotels located at the city center, too many drunk man passing by. I will definitely staying in Qbic again if the price is still this reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: rui_imc
Reviews.Content: At first it seems like a strange location but it's actually quite easy to reach and the map they provide is very simple to follow - and in Zuid it's close too all forms of transport... easy and fast to go anywhere from there. The room was quite big and the facilities very good - who cares about a bathroom door, it's on the other side of the room... really, don't know why other people complain about that.

Reviews.Title: “Surely Love to be Back at Qbic”
Reviews.Author: sholao1234
Reviews.Content: In terms of value for money, excellent service and customer's relations, I rate Qbic in the top 3 category. I love to be back there whenever I am in Amsterdam. Keep up the excellent work.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: everythingcounts
Reviews.Content: I and my boyfriend travelled around Europe for a few weeks, and Amsterdam was one of our stops. We stayed at Qbic Hotel, and we were very pleased with our stay there. The staff was very friendly when we arrived, and helped us with directions. The hotel was very close to both metro and tram. It took around 15 minutes to get to the centre with the tram. We also had a small store and restaurants close. The rooms had a cool touch with the cubic bed and bathroom. Some people can probably find it quite weird that the bathroom has no door. It was nice living a little bit outside the centre and weâ€™re very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and great for public transport”
Reviews.Author: Mewww
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed here for 3 nights and had a really lovely time. A few people have said they found it difficult to find but it's literally just to the right of the underpass and there's even a red carpet leading up to the door so you can see where it is. When we got in we were encouraged by the staff to come talk to them rather than use the self check-in, which I found to be much more personal and she even suggested somewhere for us to eat. Speaking of which Wagamama's is about a 2 minute walk from the front, which is great although a bit pricey. If you want food at night though, you're kind of stuck.. so I'd suggest getting something outside of the area before coming in if you have a late flight like we did. The lighting was a bit trippy but that's fine as we could just turn it off., and sure, there's no door on the bathroom - but guests aren't under any false pretences before showing up, the pictures clearly show there is NO door. Anyway, just run a tap or use the public one if you don't want your travelling partner to hear you do your business! No biggie. The only quarrel I had with it was that on the Thursday morning, someone started drilling something right in the hallway, then talking really loudly.. a bit of a pain when you've come for a lie in. The bed was AMAZING though. Really comfy and REALLY roomy.. although we had a window, there was no air-con and the window didn't open so my boyfriend got a bit overheated.. Still, overall we both really enjoyed our stay here and are even talking about arranging a second visit with friends. p.s. If you're using the Metro and train. The Metro ticket machines are the silver ones and the trains are yellow! The train ones don't accept notes either, which isn't very convenient when you've not had change to break a note. The Metro is way more convenient for Centraal (Make sure you type in "Amsterdam Centraal" rather than anything else) and the train is better for the airport. : ) - Oh! And the metro runs til late too, so you can still have a decent night out and know you can get home safe.

Reviews.Title: “Unique room concept”
Reviews.Author: Conjured
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located next to Amsterdam Zuid station, which is perfect if you arrive into Amsterdam via train. It is practically like 2 minutes walking distance from the station, and Amsterdam's good transport system guarantees easy access to anywhere into town. The room is a bit dark though, there is no bright / white light option, and the washroom is totally exposed to the room (no partition walls). Not the best option for 2 occupants who are not on naked-terms basis. The exposed toilet also meant that smell or poor toilet hygiene might be a potential problem. Was really impressed with the service. When i mentioned to the counter that i could not find the thermostat, she explained that the rooms are centrally heated, but nonetheless, when i returned back to the hotel at night, i found a fan heater provided on the table. Very thoughtful. On a separate occasion, i saw her helping another tourist couple finding accommodation at other hotels and all. Top marks for the staff for me. Free wireless provided was a plus, spacious rooms, a good stay indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, efficient use of space and value for money.”
Reviews.Author: koalakirsty
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this hotel enough. The location is just beside a metro/train stop so it's easy to get to from the city centre or the airport. The staff were really friendly and welcoming. The decor is really cool and the rooms have just what you need. If you're looking for a fresh, modern, compact, cheap and quiet hotel then this is for you. Their buffet breakfast (10 euros) was good value too.

Reviews.Title: “Learn staff the basics of Hospitality, which is: Friendlyness”
Reviews.Author: PaulvanB
Reviews.Content: Perhaps it's modern day big city culture, but when I'm in a hotel, 8000 km from home, I like to be treated friendly, not feeling unconfortable when asking question, I am away from home, I don't know my environment and , perhaps of this I do ask dumn questions, but does this have to result in an arrogant reaction? Besides this the room was ok, but the shower was dirty, not enough hot water and to small for people over 1.80 (bending in the morning is not a strong point of you get a certain age). Paul

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, nice comfortable and quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: Fab4ever
Reviews.Content: The Qbic hotel is right next to the exit of the railway station Amsterdam Zuid. It is not located in the city center, near the important museums, etc. but the public transport (tramway) in Amsterdam is excellent and takes you in no time where you want to go. The Qbic hotel advertises as a do-it-yourself hotel, where you can check in yourself, buy a drink and snacks in a vending machine, but when I entered a friendly girl welcomed me and even gave me no chance to check in myself. The room was bigger than expected. My room in the hotel where I stay in my holidays on Mallorca is smaller, although I have to stay there 1 or 2 weeks. The hotel is part of the big and busy WTC, but are however very quiet and the comfortable big bed ensures good night rest. As mentioned before, there are no drawers, but for a short stay I find this is not necessary. There is a big clothes hanger to put your clothes on. Also said by other contributors: the showerhead should be a little higher. This is defenately a good hotel. Prices vary according to availability, so if you look out, you can sleep here reasonably cheap. I hope that more Qbic hotels come in different cities in Europe soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean,comfortable,enjoyable and impressive with its lights!”
Reviews.Author: morvo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Qbic Hotel for 4 days in September and the first reason why I chose is about its value. Rewies were good but when we saw the hotel location, room hygiene and decoration, I was like â€œThis hotel absolutely deserves more stars!â€�. We didn't encounter anything bad about hotel or stuff during accommodation. Location is awesome! if you don't like loudy places, this hotel is very suitable for you. Also, it is very closed to the City Center... Nearest station (Zuid Station) is only 1 min and central is 10 min. Rooms were very decorative, modern and enjoyable. Bed and pillows were confortable. Bathroom was clean and colorfull too. There was no door for bathroom but it isn't in the public eye =) Stuff were helpfull, kind and also easy to communicate in English. Maybe breakfast value seems expensive but endeed it is normal when it is compared outside cafes' breakfasts.. In a sentence, I can highly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Concept sounds good, but very flawed in practice”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanVoyager
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on a business trip because I needed to catch a train early in the morning and this is next to the South/WTC railway station in Amsterdam, and because its design looked interesting. Unfortunately, this is one of these cases where pictures are misleading and inadequate. There are a few positive points too (and I'll name them at the bottom), but they are negligible in the perspective of the negatives. 1. This was my first hotel room without a window 2. Airconditioning could not be regulated within the room (without a window, that's crucial). The room temperature was probably around 25C, way too high for sleeping. 3. The walls of the room are too thin and the sound insulation of the door is inadequate. (My neighbor probably set his alarm wrong, so I woke up at 4AM. At 5 AM his friend from another room knocked on the door and I was awake again. At that moment I decided to get up myself and catch my train evenearlier than I had planned). 4. The lighting is spacy, but colored lights (you can pick your color) all the time got me a bit crazy 5. The materials are sensitive and the room had been worn down pretty fast. The positive sides then: 1. The bed is good 2. The shower is very nice Overall, unless you like a hot room, cannot stand the daylight and sleep like a rock, I recommend you not to stay in Qbic WTC Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “nice room - but not clean”
Reviews.Author: bakpaka81
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the Qbic Hotel and enjoyed our stay. The room was special and we liked it. However our room was not clean, there were several hair on our bedsheets and the floor was not clean.

Reviews.Title: “HIghly recommend - was really impressed with this hotel for the value for money”
Reviews.Author: travellingkristy
Reviews.Content: Great location - an easy 10 min tram ride to the City. The rooms were fun and very modern with all you needed in there for a short break. There was no hair dryer though, so remember to bring that. The staff were helpful and friendly. I thought it was great value for money. We were put off buy the 10 Euro breakfast which appeared to be just cold food, so didnâ€™t try that as an optional extra as thought that was fairly costly. We spent the weekend here and it over exceeded what we were looking for. We drove to Amsterdam from London and there was loads of parking over the weekend which when quoting to the parking attendant that you were staying at the Qbic hotel, we got that free for the whole weekend which was just across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome LED light”
Reviews.Author: Enigmaticvampire
Reviews.Content: I stayed a night in this hotel... and it was awesome... the staff is very friendly and really nice... Its just at the Zuid train station.. takes around 20 minutes to get to Centraal station where it all goes .... But the area is a little poor in establishment... no much resto pubs or anything around... yet the room is awesome... sat in the bed and help like sleeping.. i even slept with the led lights on.. its so nice.. but central air conditioning... this really kills and very kold at night...

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Dmitry_Ivanov
Reviews.Content: Pros: close to RAI, not so far from the city center, quite big room & bed (for Amsterdam ;), quiet place. Cons: breakfast could be a bit less modest for 200 EUR per night, no classic reception/lobby, no wardrobe/shelves in room - only very small space, same problem in the bathroom. Fun: crazy led lightning. Good for short business trips.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: lovesamsterdam
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my boyfriend in late August of 2010. I chose this hotel, because it seemed as if it was a great value for the money. After reading a few reviews, I feared the decision I made was not the right one. After staying ONE WHOLE WEEK in this hotel, all I have to say isâ€¦what in the world is everyone talking about?? I thought the hotel was perfect! The bed was comfortable, shower was great, wifi worked perfectly, and the staff and service was awesome. There is a safe in the room to keep your passports and travel information, and if you need an iron, or a blow dryer, or an outlet converter, just ask the staff and they will give you one. Oh, and yes, there are windows in the rooms, incase any of you are reading the same reviews I am, and no the rooms are not that small either- for those claustrophobics out there. To get to city center from here, take tram 5- it runs all night and picks you up and drops you off you right in front of the World Trade Center, which is where this hotel is located. Anyways, I want to thank Qbic for giving me such an awesome experience, and helping me out with all the questions I had.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: ThiagoT
Reviews.Content: Qbic is an unique kind of Hotel with pros and cons. After my wife and I stay for 3 nights, please find below my comments: Pros: - Our room was extremely new; - The shower and the bad are fantastic; - The staff is helpfull and polite; Cons: - A roundtrip journey to the city centre takes approximately one hour; - Although our room was clean in the check in, the clean service up to the check out date was not very good; - The are no restauraunts or markets options near to the hotel, mainly on Saturday and Sunday. Although we recommend the Hotel, next time we will look for an option closer to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Need a fabulous but funky place to stay? Qbic is your best bet.”
Reviews.Author: Hceux
Reviews.Content: I've long wanted to stay an unconventional hotel. This was definitely it! The room was way more mod than any rooms that I've ever been into. Looks great. Functioned well. The bed was comfortable! The bathroom was clean and functional. The lighting effects were cool. The room wasn't cramped; so I had room to do some exercises. Location: easy to get to from the Schiphol airport by train and easy to get to Amsterdam Centraal by tram. It's not in a neighbourhood so it's a cold corporate area. But, you can jump on the transit to go somewhere for dinner, sightseeing, entertainment, etc. It was nice to leave behind the hustle n bustle of the central area of Amsterdam, but not have to go very far away to get to Qbic. Staff at the Qbic were friendly, warm, and helpful. They all didn't dress in a uniform, but looked great. I liked how the staff were allowed to dressed as they wished, but still look really good. I had no problems with communicating with them in English. I arrived at the hotel at about 9am and was able to put my luggage in a make-do luggage room without any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Whacky but not really Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Spikeyd77
Reviews.Content: Ok lets start with the good, its whacky its different its modern, its close to the train and tram stations and its cheap. Now the bad, the colour changing lights do NOT work. There are no windows!! Thus you have no idea of the weather outside. There is no wardrobe and the only storage space offered is a coat stand with four coat hangers on!? And yes the bathroom does not have a door but for me this wasnt a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, very helpful staf”
Reviews.Author: anoekvacque
Reviews.Content: Rooms are what you expect from them, after checking out their website. Staff was esprecially helpful and friendly, both by phone and upon arrival. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: AncyPancy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a few nights with some friends, the rooms are really cool-love the decoration and lighting in the bedrooms. Location is cool aswell very close to station and the tram..only fault for me in the rooms was that there is not enough lighting and the lack of bathroom door makes it a tad uncomfortable if all your friends are hanging out in one room! lol other than a good stay! ***only ranked service as one as we only met one member of staff who checked us in!!***

Reviews.Title: “Cool place!”
Reviews.Author: angelomare
Reviews.Content: Qbic hotel is placed in a very strategic point: 7mins away from the airport via Train and 5 mins away from the Entertainment district via tram n. 5 Hotel is very nice, clean and people are very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed but still pretty cool!”
Reviews.Author: damsqu
Reviews.Content: Overall disappointed by this place and I have been looking for an excuse to stay here for some time. Like others my funky lighting didn't work, so I was stuck in purple mood for my stay and the room itself was a little worn. My stool was broken and the shower wasn't clean enough for me to shower in. I didn't like the fact my window looked out onto the internal quadrangle of the WTC, so I had people staring into the room when I opened my curtains. The positives. Incredibly friendly welcome. Machines pricey but a great idea, especially the change machine. Location, although not central is very easy to get to via train, tram, metro or bus. Too expensive for what it is for me to warrant another visit.

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: emspiderx
Reviews.Content: ME and my boyfriend stayed one night here and we absolutly loved it!! It's about 9 stops on a metro to the centre of Amsterdam but it's in a quiet area and isn't a faff to get to at all. Couldn't believe how lovely this was and the staff were great! We will definitly be staying at Qbic hotels again, I just wish there were more of them! ENJOY! oh and the bed is soo comfy and the shower is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location and I'll be staying there again.”
Reviews.Author: D-419
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by friendly staff. Very colorful room with LED lighting, but the best thing about the room was the bed. It was great bed for a hotel! They could use better quality towels and more of them.

Reviews.Title: “cool place, convenient , good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: dreamchaser888
Reviews.Content: room is nice, spacious with 2 big safes. Continental breakfast is good. Free internet access. Hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. Very convenient with 12mins away from Sciphol airport by train and 15mins from central station with metro that runs until midnight. Just buy a 1, 2 , or 3 days all transport pass which cost as little as 7,50e, 11,50e and 15,50e if you don't plan to visit many museums. Highly recommend to go for a day trip that visit marken, volendam (sourvenirs, food are much better here compared to Ams) , windmill, clog factory, cheese factory.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: raulds
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel from May 10th to May 12th. The first thing you need to know about Qbic is: It was suppose to be a flat apartment and it was converted to a design hotel. So the room is not the usual you expect from a hotel room. But this is not a bad thing at all. The room is clear and the bed is very comfortable. Nice shower. The staff is great. But I felt the room a bit could. Would be nice control the room temperature but the room has no temperature control. The hotel is a bit far away from Amsterdam downtown and there is not much options to eat or drink near the hotel, besides the ones that share the same building and they close early. They have vending machines on the lobby but the things are a little bit pricey. So bring your take away when you are coming back from downtown. They have breakfast for a fee but I not tried it. If you just want a cup of coffee they have a machine where you can grab for EUR 1,50. The coffee is very good besides the fact it is made on a vending machine. It was a nice surprise. Little bit more about location: The hotel is in the WTC Amsterdam Building and steps away from Zuid station. In 30 minutes tops you are in the Amsterdam Centraal Station so I dont think the location is an issue also Amsterdam has excellent transport system so you always can come back to hotel even late night.

Reviews.Title: “Chic concept and accessible to all directions”
Reviews.Author: smack666
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveller and spend most of days in a month in hotels, this is first time I stayed at a chic concept hotel. Trendy and unique. With bathrooms that dont have doors and large bed wid trendy lighting effect gives it a different dimension.. comfy beds and clean linen and towels. along with clean bathrooms too! I had stayed with my spouse and my friends with another room, we spent in total 3 days and its been memorable one. Needless to say accessbility to aiport and all directions of amsterdam is the best! Even a night bus!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for single traveller or young couple!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TUMIBOY
Reviews.Content: This hotel is modern, clean, young, colourful, design hotel. when I walk into the room, it's smell fresh, clean and lighting mode is very sexy. You would love to jump into the big bed. The receptionist is very friendly and helpful. Shower is great. It's not expensive. There are plenty of bike park outside the door and few fast food dine in place but close on Sunday. I ride my bike there, it's 20 mins ride. Quite fun if you are traveller. Of course the local would say it's too far for this location. But it's about experience in Adam. To me Adam City is not big compare to Barcelona. Or catch the tram for 15 mins from city. very convenience. Very quiet at night. good for sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A decent priced, trendy and cool hotel, not in the city centre, but right next to metro, tram and nightbus stops”
Reviews.Author: THjukkas
Reviews.Content: This was a cool hotel for with small but nice and comfortable rooms. It is not a hotel with rooms to spend any longer time in, but good for sleeping. (Altough the "double bed" is actually two beds with a thinner mattres over, so the "crack" in between was quite noticable, but it didn't bother us though) The room can feel a bit like a cellar (especially since the windows are covered and just shows the inside of a parking house) But the design of the room with the nice light effects work better without windows. The staff was very friendly and helpfull, but the breakfast was a dissapointment, when paying 10â‚¬ you could except something more, this was just the basics. For example there was only cheese to put on the bread, no vegtables or meat. The shower was nice, but the bathroom not having any door needed some getting used to.. Also the bathroom lacked a hairdryer and shelves to put stuff on, and when showering the drain could not quite keep up witjh the water so some water escaped the shower cubicle and went to the hotell floor, which is not so good I guess.. The light is cool but a bit inconvinient for longer stays. It took about twenty minutes to go to and from the city centre with the public transportation, and I thought it worked really well. A metro, tram and nighbuss stops maybe 100 m from the hotel at station zuid, so very convinient. Also if traveling by train it is possible to go get off/on directly at station zuid instead of going to the central train station. (Depending on which train you travel with I guess) Overall a very good stay tough

Reviews.Title: “thinking outside the box”
Reviews.Author: paul186337
Reviews.Content: This was good. At â‚¬95 a night it was way cheaper than other stuff in Amsterdam which is a regular haunt of ours. Good standard too. Even though we're in our 50's and it's obviously pitched at a younger,hipper market we felt welcome and valued. I know what you're thinking; the bathroom door. Get over it ! Isn't it funny how even young hip people are anally retentive ! The cube was good, the bed very comfortable but the shower room does need some tweeking in detail (i'm an architect) like the width of the shower panel, the fixing down of the wc, a shelf to put your shower stuff on, the seal around the junction with the floor etc. Underfloor heating in the cube would be a bonus and probably very easy to incorporate. On the downside it was a 15 min metro ride out of the centre but it's right next to it and the service was brilliant. All in all a positive experience. In fact we're bringing our teenage daughters back in the Summer ! Can I buy the franchise for the UK ?

Reviews.Title: “funky hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mishell1965
Reviews.Content: The hotel is funky but basic. The hotel is about a 20 minute tram ride from central Amsterdam which made it very inconenient for us. We didnt like having no toilet door, we are a bit old fashioned like that! The vending machines are expensive - 2 Euros for a bottle of water is excessive at a budget hotel. Apart from that the hotel is clean, stylish and the staff are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for cyclists”
Reviews.Author: giouxou
Reviews.Content: Service: Staff very friendly and helpfull. Free internet access at the reception area. Using magnetic stripe cards to gain access in the building, in the floor and in the room, provides extra security. Room: A small warm basic room with great lighting. The only disadvantage was the WC laking a door (it can be managed!! one web serfing free of charge at the reception area and the other using the WC). Moreover, you can not open the windows but we spent only a few hours at the hotel, mainly for a night sleep. Thus we didn't mind this flaw. We did mind though that the double bed was not actually "double". It was 2 twin beds and a matress above them that made it a double bed. Location: Based at the WTC, is a little bit far from the city center (I regard Dam Square as City Center). It takes about 25 minutes by tram. But we used a bike and we enjoyed the route (cycling is very easy in Amsterdam cyclists are highly respected).

Reviews.Title: “Quirky rent-a-cube in modern WTC office building”
Reviews.Author: canopyboy
Reviews.Content: The Qbic is a curious little euro-style property that banks on budget accomodation with a designer twist. These two qualities are probably enough to sell it as a decent option for 1-3 day stopovers in Amsterdam because you are getting hostal-type rates without the group shower experience, and a really cool bed that glows taking the edge off your Hollandesque binges. The main detractor is the Qbic's location on the outskirts of Amsterdam...where most travelers would prefer to stay in the central district within walking distance of all attractions. However the Qbic is a stone's throw away from the Zuid Tram Station which will take you all the way to Centraal Station in central Amsterdam, or out to the Airport in the other direction. This makes it pretty convenient for those who are traveling by air or train. Best of all is when I traveled on this train there was no charge for the rides. The hotel is nearly all self-service with a check-in check-out machine in the lobby, and an interesting hide-and-seek game to find out which of the 30-some odd doors along the WTC building is the actual hotel entrance (its in the back near the giant bike rack). The rooms are nice and modern, but a little cramped even for two people...but for the value its appropriate and comfortable. As the hotel is effectively the basement of the WTC, there's not much by the way of a windows and natural light, which is why they have adorned your room with lunar lighting. The few employees at the Qbic were extremely friendly and hospitable, serving a great continental breakfast and making sure guests problems were resolved. All things considered the Qbic is a great value for its class, comfortable and quiet. If you can handle a short tram ride to get places it will save you some money.

Reviews.Title: “Great for 60euros!”
Reviews.Author: claut
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel @11 the girl in the lobby told us that the checking was till 3 but she offer to keep the lugagge which was very gentle! The rooms are cool, quite groovy, the room was clean but the bathroom has no door which can get a lil uncomfortable if traveling with friends hahaha. I think is a great hotel for 60 euros and everything is 10 or 15 min away with the metro or tram which stops just infront of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: europetraveller_10
Reviews.Content: Everything is about excellent.Staffs are very helpful and nice.The room was quite a surprise becasue of its open door bathroom and toilet.Its alight if you travel with a friend or its exciting for couples.The bed and the whole bathroom and toilet is all in one unit.So that means you feel the water dropping when you are on the bed when the other one is taking the shower.This can be a bit annoying.However,the drainage is unbelievably effective becasue the water is all gone in 30seconds, Good connection to airport and town.There is direct tram and train to the shopping areas, musee street and central station.Train to airport is just 5min ride. The only downside of the hotel is that theres no 24h reception.But its still alight becasue the night security will try his best to help. Centainly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and Clean but a bit wonky!”
Reviews.Author: mystericj
Reviews.Content: Pros: the rooms themselves are huge, the bed-module is futuristic and massive, the vending machines are convenient, Zuid-station and tram-stops into Amsterdam proper are a stone's throw away, and the complex is near some much-missed green space. Cons: NO DOOR ON THE BATHROOM is the major drawback in the design, as is the lack of noise barriers on the front door itself. Hitched into a major office block and complex, the place is perfect for business people working at or near the WTC (and has free wireless throughout!!!) but is not ideal for late-night coming home from the city itself, which is some distance from Zuid. If you are in town on a business conference, stay here and bask in the neon light; if not, and you are looking to savour the flavour of real Amsterdam, try something more central!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, friendly & helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: J0hn55555
Reviews.Content: The hotel, spread over different floors in the Amsterdam world trade centre was a comfortable experience. The rooms different than most hotels, sort of "modules" with bed and shower buildt together. no door to the toilet took some getting used to :-) but is no problem except if you wind while going :-). The bed was perfect and comfortable - amongst the best hotel beds we've had anywhere. because they're built in, they dont move if you,re a wild sleeper! Light and decor in the room is...well different...but you can create your own mood with the lighting. The staff is exceptionally helpful, patient and friendly! But be aware of the no smoking in the rooms policy in the Netherlands! It is right next to the train station, but it is better to use the tram or bus (other side of the WTC) to centre. Direct trains to Schiphol though. On the square there is a small supermarket and even a takeaway restaurant. In the reception of the hotel they serve a reasonable breakfast (10 euro) and they have a coffee machine and vending machine for soft drinks, beer and chocolate. Very practical if you need drink or snacks at odd hours!!

Reviews.Title: “Very cheap, clean and modern, but maybe not appropriate for more than one person in a room”
Reviews.Author: elcachorrito
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed in the Qbic in Amsterdam. Pluses include price (GBP 44 for two people), free wifi, closeness to Amsterdam business center (it's in the World Trade Center), cleanliness, ease of use and quietness (due to lack of windows, perhaps). Minuses include no door on toilet room or shower, lighting is a bit strange (main light is colored light), one bed only (although maybe you can pay for more), far from city center and centraal station (though you can take a metro to get there and the hotel is very close to the Zuid stop) and no windows in room.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary rooms with good connections”
Reviews.Author: Ortwin
Reviews.Content: The rooms are modern and typical presenting you a mixture of just what you would need in a new setting. Rooms are spacious, clean, whereas the facilities itself are limited. Use th hotel as you like, bt staff and food is available around the clock. The idea that you can adjust the atmosphere did not work well; I only had blue lights available. Good train connections to the airport. Fair connections to city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky, clean, modern and affordable”
Reviews.Author: rd327
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with clean, stylish, cozy rooms and friendly staff. This is a very modern hotel with elevators and stairs. It's located at the WTC complex by the Amsterdam Zuid(south) station so it's convenient to get to from the Airport. Could be a little trickier from the #5 tram line; just make sure you print out the directions. After that, it depends where you need to go. It's a bit far to walk into the center from here but the 5 tram takes you right to most of the popular tourist destinations. You'd be fine on bikes as well. It's not a terribly Dutch place so if you want a more authentic hotel (in a 200 year old building with steep stairs, single pane glass and no elevator but closer to the center), look elsewhere but if you want a really nice place to stay for not much money, this is your place. My only minor complain was that the room was a bit cold and I found no way to adjust the thermostat but under the covers I slept fine.

Reviews.Title: “Freezed to death”
Reviews.Author: victorjl
Reviews.Content: 2 words: centralized climatization. They couldn't turn off the air-con, so we ended up with a small appliance to keep us warm while the air-con was still on! To compound it, the mattresses were so bad (looked to me like wool filled or something, back from last century) that I ended up with a contracture in the neck, so I had to stop my sight-seeing. Also, the breakfast was very expensive. Just in front of the hotel, in the WTC plaza, there is a couple of places to have better food and half the price.

Reviews.Title: “AmsterdamÂ´s Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: TriumphTiger
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights (I actually have an appt here but needed some peace and quiet and a good internet connection for work) Initially was a little apprehensive due to some of the reviews and the fact that itÂ´s inside the WTC, but having spent 2 peaceful, warm (yes the rooms may be cold sometimes but you can get a heater from the very helpful staff that warms it up really quick) nights I have to say I am impressed. (and I dont impress easily) My old first choice for a hotel here was the Arena but since theyÂ´ve refurbed their prices have doubled so this is now my first choice. Pros: Brilliant , helpful friendly staff (which in AMS is rare as hens teeth) Fantastically comfortable bed and duvet. Funky lighting and design. Location is superb as you have station zuid right outside along with Burger King, Albert Hein and several bars, restaurants. Cons: Got woken at 3am by the shower coming on, blew the main fuse in room twice and the broke the door entry system, but then the staff fixed all this with no fuss whatsoever, so not really a con. Would I use this place again, most def. am booking in for next week :)

Reviews.Title: “perfect place for a comfortable night”
Reviews.Author: LouisaBrussels
Reviews.Content: Qbic is a trendy, practical and comfortable place to stay (near WTC, airport and well connected to the city center, by metro). The staff is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Design Hotel - Cool, but the parking...”
Reviews.Author: Travelmx88
Reviews.Content: Hotel design is cool, unfortunately LED colour-changing system was off-duty (due to be repaired soon). Room was cold, no thermostat available. Staff very helpful. Walking distance to the Amsterdam-Sud Railway Station, which may be very good. Hotel price interesting (58.- EUR), but then the parking in the WTC building was 29.- EUR. Pity, because the hotel is worth a visit, but with this parking burden you get a price that can book better places (it was no Exhibition time).

Reviews.Title: “Don't Let the Neon Lights Fool You”
Reviews.Author: nxb807
Reviews.Content: After much anticipation to stay here, my boyfriend and I were greatly disappointed. The front desk assistant was very nice; however, he advised of a few warnings that caught my attention. As my initial reservation failed to include my mobile number, he requested that I enter the information. This was no problem - it was the fact that my number would be needed to alert me of any temperature changes and/or leaks in my room. What?! I wanted to leave at this point, but I decided not to be too hasty. I was most displeased with the bathroom flooring and shower area. With its cheap construction and dingy appearance, it gave off a vibe that was less than sanitary. Had I stayed long enough to bathe, shower shoes would have been a necessity. The bed was also satisfactory; however, even when a room's decor falls short, a luxurious bed changes everything. With a room located at the ground level, we found no choice but to keep our curtains drawn. I'm a big fan of natural light, or even artificial light when all other options fail. This room offered none of the above. It had such a sad, depressing feel to it that it literally changed my state of mind. And despite the fact that the cost was non-refundable, and regardless of the fact that I totally couldn't afford to waste the money, my boyfriend and I checked out an hour later. CitizenM has been our hotel of choice for all our Amsterdam visits, and after our visit to the Qbic will remain as such. Despite the neon lighting and quirky interior design, the Qbic Hotel strives to compete with citizenM but falls short at every level.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: sarniajoey
Reviews.Content: Girlfriend and I decided to stay here on final leg of backpacking trip in Europe. We stayed for four nights and got a much better rate than the two of us would have had together at a hostel, paying for two beds over the weekend. Found the hotel to have great flair, very great location to Zuid station. Room was artistic, clean, and private. Bed was comfortable. Loved the progressive thought put into the design of the room! Internet station in lobby along with self-check in. Housekeeping was consistent. There were two front office people alternating shifts, and they were VERY friendly, professional, and approachable. Internet station (free) in lobby. THANK YOU FOR THE GREAT STAY!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: TonvH
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just for 1 night but can definitely recommend this hotel. It has everything that a business and a private traveller needs, has a very good location, has very good value for money, friendly staff etc. This hotel shows smart thinking! This will make many people happy. Due to the "openness" of the bathroom I would advise a colleague to have a separate room.

Reviews.Title: “10/10 for the personnel - extremely friendly and competent”
Reviews.Author: zalmforel
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in Qbic for mixed purposes. I had to attend a meeting in RAI, my partner joined me for leisure. The location is excellent. Extremely convenient for international travel as it is so near the Zuid Station. A very short walk straight through the park, and you're at the RAI. A short trip with tram to where you can hire a bike, and you're completely set. It is a bit strange waking up in the morning completely in darkness with no window at all, so you have to wait until you're outside to check the weather; but as it's only for a couple of days and you don't have to live nor work in a room, whatever. Absolutely the best was the staff. Extremely friendly and helpfull, no fuzz at all, 10/10 !

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, good value, unusual but it works!”
Reviews.Author: crunchieLondon
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here 3 nights, attending conference at the RAI and this was very convenient - one train stop from Schipohl and a short walk. The hotel is clean, basic amenities, unusual modular concept. The staff were the best part - all friendly, welcoming, very helpful. Thank you for lending me an umbrella all day when it ws raining! Will definitely use again if I'm in this part of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “V odd, but v enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: Wiglet1981
Reviews.Content: I should begin by nothing that this is an extremely odd hotel. It is built into the World Trade Center in Amsterdam, fifty yards from Zuid station. So you'd expect a soulless chain hotel with no personal touch or flair, and all mod cons. Both expectations are refuted! Let's begin with the positives. (1) The staff: The staff are exceptionally warm, welcoming, friendly, and obliging. And, in contrast to the big chain hotels, you feel that they really are pleased to help, rather than merely parroting a line from a training session. (2) The breakfast: The "foyer" of the hotel is the design masterpiece of the place. It's just lovely. The perfect combination of modern and yet cosy. The breakfast is served here at a strangely-shaped white lacquer long table. It consists of croissants with gorgeous homemade jam, boiled eggs, pastries, cereals, fruit juice, coffee, and an excellent array of fresh fruit -- kiwi, apples, bananas, oranges, strawberries, and grapes. (3) Free fast WiFi: Perhaps this is just taken for granted in some more civilised countries, but here in Europe, it is extremely hard to find. And it make SO much difference. I could check my email, do my work, and plan my sightseeing on my laptop from the comfort of my room. (4) The design: The owners clearly had a field day designing this place. It certainly isn't chic -- which I think is perhaps what they wanted -- because there are just too many different styles of design clashing with one another, but it is extremely fun. And it manages to be a lovely and interesting place to stay. One problem is that the fittings are inevitably getting scratched a little now, and the minimalist design is suffering as a result. But this is a small complaint. (5) The customer service: I had problems with my room when I stayed. Through no fault of the hotel's, there was a lot of maintenance work being done in the World Trade Centre late at night and I could hear this in my room. I complained about this and received an extremely prompt and courteous response together with very generous compensation for my disturbed nights. This was very impressive service. (6) Initially, you think that this would be no good for a sightseer, but in fact if you're a keen walker, the route north to the south side of the Vondelpark makes for a lovely route in to Amsterdam, through an exceptionally wealthy and beautiful part of town. For business people, the location is simply ideal. Zuid station is next door. You can be in Schipol in 20 mins. And you can be in the business district in 5 mins maximum. And let's finish with the negatives, though there are far fewer: (1) Inexplicably, there is no phone in the rooms!! So you can't call reception is something goes wrong! (2) There is no way of controlling the air conditioning/heat in the room. Though actually this was never a problem, as the temperature in the room was always just right for me. All in all, then, I would thoroughly recommend this little oddity to anyone who needs to be in that area of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “For young and brave”
Reviews.Author: sandu_18
Reviews.Content: If you really love hi-tech style and freedom and do not care about superfluous conveniences, you have to stay in this hotel. Absolutely ascetic room contains only bed with glow, combined with bath room without door. It's unusual, it's fun, it's cool!! We enjoyed breakfasts, really, they were delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Qbic: really stylish but "form did NOT follow function"”
Reviews.Author: Harm_en_Anne
Reviews.Content: For me this hotel is an extraordinary and a little more luxurious alternative for a Formule 1 hotel. The design of the hotel-rooms is outstanding. But, form has to follow function and in my opinion it doesn't in this hotel. Some examples: no hooks for towels or clothes near the shower. The shelve above the sink was too small to put my toiletries without falling down, the bath-qbic is getting really wet when having a shower with can be slippery, you can't open the windows, there where no glasses, there's hardly any normal light to put on, only 'spacy-lights', there's always a small red led-light shining in the room, you can't switch it off completely, you have to take a step up to go to the toilet which can be risky at night (I hurt my foot badly). I've stayed here three nights and my room was not cleaned very well. Especially under the bed was a lot of dust. But, we evaluated the hotel with all of our colleages and our conclusion is that it's a good value for money (good beds!) and a good spot for going downtown, to do business in the WTC or to go the RAI.

Reviews.Title: “If you like somthing difference”
Reviews.Author: MisterIron
Reviews.Content: Positive points about my stay: Very close to Amsterdam Zuid train station, fancy look of room, free Internet, comfortable bed, good shower. Points for improvement: Low service concept, no real reception, no possibility in the bathroom to hang anything, Conclusion, I go again for one or two nights if I need to be in the area around Amsterdam-Zuid but not for a private holiday.

Reviews.Title: “It was Good.”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel0202
Reviews.Content: The Qbic hotel was a good hotel. The price was affordable, it was clean and in a great location. The hotel is really close to the subway station and the tram. It is about a a 10 minute ride to the centre and the tram comes often and runs pretty late. There is a Albert Heign grocery store right beside the hotel, they sell a lot of ready made sandwiches, pasta, fruit etc. The hotel has a microwave so you can purchase foods and warm them up. The hotel is located in the World Trade Centre building, the interior is professional and cozy. On the weekend the hotel is quiet. The rooms are spacious the internet worked okay. They also have a free computer downstairs for public use. The TV had few American channels. The neighborhood is cozy and great for walking. I felt safe at this hotel. It is in walking distance to Citizen M. Citizen M seems to be a bit better but they tend to also be a bit pricier. The only thing we didn't like was the bed, we found it to be too low and uncomfortable, the bathroom does not have a door and the water tends to clog up when you are taking a shower. There are plenty of washrooms outside of the room that you can use if you are uncomfortable with the no door thing. The colour lighting is cool you can also get clear lighting if you want as well.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish option”
Reviews.Author: pjh3121
Reviews.Content: I was in Amsterdam attending a conference and this hotel was near the university venue. The room was big, the bed was king size and very comfortable, the staff were very friendly (as are all Dutch people it seems) and the breakfast was nice and fresh. The only slight downside is that I got the impression that the daily room clean was a bit perfunctory - they just changed the towels - but nothing too detrimental to the overall cleanliness of the room as it felt clean already. It takes about half an hour to get into the city centre but that's not a big problem. What is a big problem is the over complex and confusing tram system...but that's not the hotel's fault obviously ! So, don't be put off by the slightly odd look of the rooms as they really do work well once you're in them and you've worked out what all the buttons do. Very comfortable overall.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive on paper, reality somewhat different”
Reviews.Author: skyscraper101
Reviews.Content: Having been to Amsterdam a few times and stayed in some of the budget hotels more centrally located, I decided that it would be interesting to investigate a more modern hotel in the financial district. The Qbic seemed like a good choice with its 'Cubi' style rooms with multi-coloured lighting effects such as 'Mellow Yellow, Red Romance or Deep Purple Loveâ€¦' Perfect, it might seem for a romantic weekend break? Sadly no. Room 1: I was allocated a ground floor room which had no door on the bathroom, and no mood lighting. Funky lighting effects aside, even the most basic of hotels and hostels I've stayed in have had a DOOR on the bathroom. No matter how comfortable you may be around your partner, I'm sure most people would appreciate a door to close while they're on the toilet. When I mentioned it to the manager (Kim) she explained that the rooms here were 'not finished.' Yes, NOT FINISHED. Also as there were no other rooms I could transfer to until the next day, we were not able to transfer to a room that was finished. Great. I don't want to seem unnecessarily picky, but I do find it unacceptable to have paid a fair price for a two night stay in the Qbic hotel (booked through reputable Internet-based travel agency Expedia) only to be allocated a room which is 'not finished.' Even a courtesy call or email would have been appreciated but there was no communication about the lack of lighting or bathroom door, and it was not even mentioned when I checked in. It was left to me to approach Kim about it who apologised but explained that there was nothing she could do as the hotel was fully booked. As a courtesy to my girlfriend, I had to leave her alone in the room for 20 minutes so she could use the bathroom in privacy. So there I was, walking around a desolate business park alone just so she can get some bathroom privacy. I don't find that acceptable. Something so simple should be standard. As for the misleading photo of the TV on the Qbic website, not all the rooms have a TV fitted to the wall facing the bed. The first room I was given had a TV mounted to an arm on the wall with cables fully visible (see photos). Room 2: We were finally able to transfer to the second room where I was told the lighting would be working the following day. Still with no bathroom door to be seen, I set about trying to find the controls to change the mood effects from 'Mellow Yellow' to 'Red Romance' - after a 10 minute search and not being able to find the controls which (although not working) were easy to find in the first room, I went downstairs again to enquire how to change the colour with the manager. He explained that the controls were actually now hidden away and if I wanted to change the colour, I would have to open up the cabinet where the TV was housed and there should be a controller inside. Asked if it would be able to change colour automatically (as the first room's controls suggested) - I was told no. I would have to select the colour by opening the cabinet and manually changing each time. To do this I had to lift up the mattress and prize open the metal door to reach the switch. In the end I gave in and just left it on one colour, preferring not to keep removing the mattress just to have a new effect. The bathroom was smaller and its floor was metallic, not like the first room. I also noticed how thin the walls are by being kept awake at 4am by people laughing in adjacent rooms. To be fair to this hotel, it has its good points: it is very close to Amsterdam Zuid station and one stop away from Schipol Airport, it provides a decent breakfast of cereal, croissants, pain au chocolate, coffee, orange juice, fruits and yoghurt (for 10 Euro) and it has free Wi-Fi in all rooms, as well as a communal iMac with internet access in the reception area. There are vending machines providing chocolates, drinks, and basic dry food like noodles and it is easy to get to central Amsterdam on the number 5 tram. It would be perfect in fact for a single, business traveller who simply needs a room for one night (providing they are not disturbed during the night by other guests). However, if it's a weekend break you have in mind (perhaps with a partner or friend) it has many flaws. The financial district at the weekend is like a ghost town. None of the restaurants are open beyond 9pm (I tried to eat at Wagamamas at 9:30pm and it was closed) so if you want to eat in the evening beyond then, you have to either have to go to a more central location, phone for a delivery, or buy noodles or chocolate from the vending machines in the reception area. The management weren't particularly helpful in this area. What is painfully apparent is that the managers are overstretched between checking the rooms, acting as receptionist, organising check-in and check-out and handling breakfast duties. There really needs to be more people in attendance. If they are not around you have to phone for them which (although appreciated) is not ideal. My advice to anybody wishing to stay the Qbic is to phone and email ahead to make sure they will be allocated a room which is finished with bathroom door, and lighting as pictured on the website. I would also advise to bring earplugs if you are sensitive to noise from the surrounding rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel,clean,good value for money”
Reviews.Author: amsterdam0709
Reviews.Content: Great service, although we couldnt check in early (our flight got in at about 8am), they let us leave our luggage in the hotel so we didnt have to lug it around all day. A bit far out if you want to go to the centre but there are always trams and trains going so it wasnt much of a problem. We were given complimentary coffee and pan au chocolate in the morning which was nice! The room was nice although the LED display to control the different light settings didnt work, but we were only there for one night so it didnt bother us too much. The bed was really comfy and the shower head was huge so that was really good! It had everything we needed for our one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place, comfy bed, nice breakfast, floor a little dusty”
Reviews.Author: FranklySwitzerland
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay. For a budget place, the room is quite big. Would even come back as a couple, although then some kind of sliding door on the toilet would definitely be a welcome addition. Helpful staff and nice breakfast. The floor was a bit dusty.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel in business district”
Reviews.Author: CharityK13
Reviews.Content: We spent a total of six nights at this boutique hotel just outside of Amsterdamâ€™s city center. A 25-minute ride on Tram 5 from Centraal Station, this business clientele-focused hotel, was a good place to stay. Transit connections were very close to the hotel and were easy to use with plenty of friendly GVB personnel nearby to direct your travel questions. The lobby was comfortable and the snack machines were very convenient. An internet-ready PC was available in the lobby but the Wifi in the room was even better. The bed was very comfortable and the side chair and desk were very well designed. The various lighting options were nice to have and we did not mind the open bathroom stylings, however, it was a bit cold to shower in the morning. In the future, I will probably stay closer to city center, however, this was a good Amsterdam â€œstarterâ€� hotel in a quiet neighborhood. One drawback is that as the area is primarily a business district, there were few eating/entertainment options available at night and on the weekend. That said, during weekdays, the Albert Heijn convenience store nearby offers a great selection of food and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Not so cheap and chic”
Reviews.Author: Pru17
Reviews.Content: The highlights of this hotel are its location and the minimalist concept ( with both positive and negative aspects). It is quite well situated, with tram and metro lines nearby taking you to the city center in about 15 minutes. Besides the hotel itself is located inside WTC, which is a very pleasant business center. As other customers already stated, it was not that easy to find it at first, since precise information is lacking in the description of the hotel when you book it: for foreigners they should more clearly indicate that you must enter the building to find Qbic. My partner and I appreciated the overall setting of the room: the 'cube' is functional, with comfortable bed and chairs, but what was most annoying was the absence of door separating the bathroom from the rest of the room. Ok, you get a sort of open space cubic room, that is nice, yet adding just a panel would not have spoiled the whole concept! When asking the staff about it, the girl just answered that most of the customers were business travellers, people alone, so that usually nobody does not mind. She added that we could use the public bathrooms situated on the floors, but considering the price you pay, it bothered me not to have a real private one! Now about the possibility of changing the light of the room: at first we thought that the switch was broken so we asked the staff. They said that the button was indeed difficult to find and came to show us where it was. It was in fact hidden in the part where the TV screen is, behind a panel. And it may be a detail, but again, this is not mentioned anywhere, while on the door of the room, the hotel boasts about this function. So we managed to change the colours of the light but I saw that many customers who did not bother to ask missed that opportunity. To sum up, the staff and service was very good but one could expect more for value.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: hailijade
Reviews.Content: Pretty cool hotel!! I loved it! A little hard to find though (signs are small) - its inside the WTC offices. We arrived a little before the check-in time, but our room was ready so the girl at reception was good and let us in. They also have free wi-fi, so that was good! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Slick, Groovy and Amazing Value”
Reviews.Author: BKR_0n_the_r0ad
Reviews.Content: Classic Scandinavian minimalist style, but with more comfortable beds. Very fast WIFI with great working space / desk. Plenty of space in the room, great furniture. Will use it every time Im in AMS. Nothing bad to say.

Reviews.Title: “An experience not to miss - but not to repeat. A Full Honest Review.”
Reviews.Author: katjad
Reviews.Content: After a lot of debating, me and my husband booked ourselves to the Qbic hotel in WTC Amsterdam - there are cheaper and more centrally located hotels about; true; but the pictures of the hotel and the surroundings, talks of easy transport and again, the pictures of the hotel convinced us that this was the one for us. The hotel was relatively pricey at roughly Â£95 per night, but we did book at a rather last minute so the price was what we were expecting anyway (and on the same level as the more central locations). I'm not sure who's fault it was, but I used a debit card to book the hotel, and it seems they reserved the money and then charged it - a normal procedure for a credit card but sadly not for a debit card - so the whole sum of the booking was deducted from my account, but also remained "earmarked", reserved but not collected. I contacted booking.com (through who we booked the hotel), the hotel themselves and my bank, and everyone simply spread their hands and said "we can't do anything". The hotel only saw the one charge that had gone through, booking.com didn't know anything and my bank was simply useless. It took a week and several phone calls for the reserved money to suddenly reappear back to my bank account, and I'm still none the wiser as to how that happened. So my advice is to use a credit card when booking this hotel, or using booking.com. We arrived to Amsterdam around 19.30, and bought a 72 h BVB ticket for the duration of our stay. This set us back â‚¬15 per person, but it is definitely worth it considering the location of the hotel. The tram to use is the number 5, which you can catch right from the front of the Central Station (should you not take the train straight to the Zuid station from the airport - we didn't). The tramride takes about 15 mins, so not long at all, and the views during the ride are fantastic so the ride doesn't really get taxing. Most of the sights of Amsterdam are on the line 5 anyway, so this tram route is very handy for everything. Embark at the Zuid station and behind you - lo and behold, is the World Trade Centre, in which the hotel is. The hotel is located in the C-tower, which just happens to be right in front of you when you turn to face the building from the tram stop, so it is very easy to find. Don't go down the stairs - there is a entrance on the wall facing you and this is the quickest way to the hotel. After office hours and during the weekends you do need to buzz yourself in, but this is usually the practise with other hotels as well after hours, and we got in very quickly once we buzzed at the door, so we didn't find this to be a problem. Once you are in the lobby, take a left and you see the sign for the Qbic hotel - it is easy to find. Don't be fooled by the TNT delivery service place that you have to walk through - you are on the right path. The hotel is experiencing some renovations at present, the check-in place and the lounge are now situated on level 1, once passed the TNT space just take a left and the elevators are there. We didn't have to use the self-check-in service, the girl working there checked us in and was very helpful and nice. Our room was on the second floor, so we went up again and to the long corridor on which all the rooms were. The walls are painted and the lighting was green so it did look rather groovy - and easily spotted from afar if one was a bit confused if they were on the right path to the rooms. On the opposite side from our room, down the corridor, there was some maintenance work being done, and it wasn't covered very well if at all, but we didn't really mind as you don't really spend your time in the corridor. The room itself was wonderful. Airy, massive windows, and most importantly; clean (I even did the black-sock-on-the-floor test and got no dust - excellent). The bed is the comfiest bed I have ever slept in while in a hotel and the comfy chair in the room is just brilliant. Our moodlighting was, I assume, broken, and we were stuck with blue, but there was enough of natural light from the windows, or from the 3-4 normal lights in the room to not mind. Now, the rumours are true, there is no door on the toilet, so if you are squirmish about your bodily produce, you might want to ask your partner to leave the room (or use the toilets at the elevators) but we didn't mind this, suprisingly, I didn't hear a thing and no smells stayed in the room either! After a shower the room wasn't damp or moist (in our opinion) and the mirror cleared from mist very quickly. The shower itself is a small level lower than the toilet area, so water shouldn't really get to the floor there (there are plenty of towels on offer though should that happen) The wifi works perfectly and is very quick - quicker than in your avarage hotel offering free wifi. There is also a safe in the room if you want to leave your valuables there. No cupboard for clothes, but a clothes rack with hangers and lots of space to lay them elsewhere (there were 2 chairs that we utilized). Also, there is a flat screen telly on the wall of the bed. Our Cubi unit was, unfortunately, just a little shabbily done, it seemed not all the panels were on the same level, in the shower there was only a little hole on the floor to srain the water (no drain net or anything) and the moodlighting wasn't operational, but we didn't think this was such a massive let down that we wouldn't enjoy our stay. Furthermore - we didn't get disturbed by other guests at all; didn't hear anyone through our walls or anything, it was actually very peaceful and relaxing. You might hear a few voices when people walk down the corridor or slam their doors, but other than that - not at all. The lounge area is amazing, we really liked it. There is also a microwave if you bring your own food, you can ask for plates or cutlery from the staff and there is also a coffee machine, and self-service units to buy drinks, crisps and the likes off. We didn't have the â‚¬10 breakfast, I didn't even see it but my husband said that it was all continental (fruit, cereal etc) and for an English bloke, that's just not enough. You can get a more substantial breakfast for the same price from town, and as already established, it's not that far away. Also, for those who smoke, or have come to Amsterdam to smoke - be aware that the rooms are non-smoking and the windows are difficult to open, if the can be opened at all.
