But on the level 2, if you continue past the hotel entrance (also the entrance to the TNT space) there is a smoking area, which is open 24 h a day. Also, for those wanting a night out, and are put off my the fact that the last tram comes here around half past 12 in the night, if you have bought a GVB pass, this is also usable in the night busses, and these are really easy to use, on the tram stop there is a map and timetable for nightbusses, only one comes here and it follows the tramline, so it is very easy. All in all, we really liked the Qbic hotel. It definitely is an experience not to miss, but we doubt we would go again. This is by no means a statement against the hotel, we just would rather stay in a completely self-catered flat next time we go. If they paid a little more attention to a few details (like perfecting the Cubi-units, hiding the maintenance and construction work, be a little clearer where everything is etc) this would be a perfect hotel for anyone wanting to try something different and really enjoy a hotel that has cool enough rooms to hang out in. You might not want to go again, but one experience is more than enough.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Town, but a bit far from the center”
Reviews.Author: thenotoriousmat
Reviews.Content: We saw this hotel on some BBC business traveler review and thought it looked interesting so we decided to give it a shot for one night. The hotel turned out to be by far the best value we found in the extraordinarily over-priced Amsterdam hotel market. The Qbic keeps prices down by being a sort of DIY hotel. You check in and out with a credit card swipe - there isn't really a lobby or a concierge. Room service consists of a 24 high tech snack machine (complete with a decent beer selection). However there are a few helpful staff members floating around to answer questions if you need them. There's also free wifi and a free computer in the "lobby" area. The hotel is in an office building, which means there are no windows in the rooms - but Qbic makes up for this with cleverly designed rooms and funky neon lights. The whole experience is meant to be post-modern and kitschy and it succeeds. The real highlight of the joint is the price. We paid $89 US for a room that was vastly superior to anything else in Amsterdam for under $100 (you can't even get a youth hostel for that price). We only booked one night at the Qbic because we were concerned that the location would be annoying. Later that week we needed to find another hotel room and ended up wandering all over the center of town looking at overpriced dumps and wishing we had booked another night at the Qbic. The fact is the location, right inside the WTC office buidling, is not pretty. You'll need to take a 15 minute tram ride into the center of town whenever you want to leave the hotel. But the tram stops right in front of the WTC building and runs late. Frankly I didn't mind the tram ride, particularly once I discovered how superior the Qbic rooms were compared to rooms in the center of town. I would also recommend Qbic over an airport hotel, as the WTC location is much more accessible by both tram and rail. Finally, if you're on a business trip and need to be near the airport but don't want to stay at a boring expensive airport hotel, Qbic is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, smart, very comfortable but a little out of town”
Reviews.Author: Rediof
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Qbic for four nights and the hotel quality and service is excellent, one tip for travellers who like to party beyond midnight though . . . this isn't for you. It's a little out of town and the last tram is at 12:15am, a taxi from the centre cost me nearly 30Euros after missing the last tram. If your trip is just for sightseeing this is a great hotel with most of the big sights directly on the no 5 tram line into the centre. One train stop from the airport, it has both train and tram stops right outside the building. Security is good as you are in the World Trade Centre building and the hotel rooms are spacious and very comfortable if a little quirky in design. I'd certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in minimal style modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aureli0
Reviews.Content: Really nice and comfortable rooms, kind staff, very silent and, very important, Internet wireless connection at no additional cost

Reviews.Title: “Really comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: paris8arr
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel; Its very orginal I attach some pictures of my room

Reviews.Title: “Something that one would never expect”
Reviews.Author: IamlegendBerlin
Reviews.Content: Dear fellow travellers, I am a business traveller in the creative industries, so this place was booked by my secretary because of some mentioning in Wallpaper or something of that sort. My stay will provide me with the most ridiculous travel story I have to tell and I want to share it with you and as many people as possible. Here you go: After realizing on late arrival in Amsterdam that I would have to go directly to my meeting and check in later I called Qbic and asked if that would be a problem, already being confused that the hotel seemed to be in a closed compound without direct street access and, very important for me, no obvious place where a cab should pick me up. Well needless to say I was told that check in at around 11pm would be no problem whatsoever. On trying to talk a cab driver into taking me to the WTC he adamantly wanted to tell me that there is no hotel in the compound and nevertheless proud me to an entrance to a very lifeless architectural structure. I rang a bell at 11.02pm, entered and the real story begins here. Finding the hotel in the empty, lifeless lobby-like structure is somewaht possible if you are brave enough to conquer a space that seems very empty and as if you are trespassing every step of the way. One can find the approximation of a reception though, eventually, I did around 11.10. It is all machines, very 2001, unfortunatedly the checkin machine was not working and I was refer to the clerk, who was nowhere to be seen. At around 11.15 I started to call the phone number on my reservation paper. I spoke to somebody in Maastricht who told me that the situation I was in would be impossible that I couldn't be all alone in that compound, yet: I was and after he was somewhat convinced of my desperate need for a bed and my right to have one due to the reservation numbers I gave to him, he gave me a telephone number to call. I did and was perplexed when the phone right next to me in the empty machinery scenery began to ring. I was so surpised to pick up....and hear myself on my cell. I called mastricht again, got another dose of disbelief and eventually a cell phone number. I called that number at around 11.30, wandering around in the empty modern wilderness, thinking about Jim Jarmush and Will Smith in I am Legend and thinking of hitting one of the sofas while waiting for someone to answer that cell phone. Well nobody did. It was Maastricht again, they told me to go back to start. 11.45. Now what do you do in the middle of nowhere with nowhere to go to. You think about your early flight out, 6.50 and how precious minutes of "sleep" are replaced by anxiety and amusement. And you swear that you will fire your secretary and tell everybody and their dog that Qbic is not a concept but a fraud. Obviously when thinking to oneself, one uses another kind of language, not advisable to rephrase those words here. So thoughts about home cross your mind, you look out of the windows into an outside that is as empty and desolated as the strange inside you have to share with...machines, nothing else, just things, ticking away. Ring, something like a elevatorbell from where the checkin machine was! You run back, and: a person welcomes you, sort of. Nice guy, you hate him immediatedly but he actually is so nice that you forgive him and go to the room taking the card from him and preparing yourself for what a hip hotel might be like. It is like a officers cabin on battlestar Galactica, maybe, with lights so that the junkies can't do the fix, kind of fancy. Well after 4 solid hour I begged for the nice person to have fullfilled my only dream, to organize a cab for me to take me to the airport. The cab was there, the driver asked what i was doing in the building this time of day, didn't want to belive that there is a hotel inside, I kind of got his drift and agreed and was happy thinking about home. Only downside to the ending: because there is no street, the cab charges you 7,50 Euro just for waiting in the noman's land for you. I gave them to him, even now I can hardly believe my welcome at the Qbic Amsterdam, why should he believe that there is a hotel at the WTC with guests who might go somewhere from nowhere? I was asked if the stay was less than perfect, well, most certainly so! Do not even think about punishing the night clerk, he was the best thing in the whole bizarre scenario. I didn't fire my secretary either. For all others out there: Do not go into that thing that misnames itself as a hotel unless you like the kind of experiences sketched above. best regards

Reviews.Title: “Won't come back!”
Reviews.Author: Paulo P
Reviews.Content: We were very curious about this concept Hotel in Amsterdam. Our expectations were high and that is part of the reason why we weren't very satisfied. First of all we arrived at the Hotel around 11.30am and had to wait until 2pm to enter the room because they were cleaning it - not sure how they cleaned it since we found a dirty floor as well as a bandage in the toilet - no excuse. Regarding the toilet people should know there is no door - quite awkward to say the least. At night as we were watching some tv and talking people from the room next door knocked on the wall - I guess they were trying to sleep. This means the walls are not sound proof at all. On top of this, the Hotel is a bit far from the city centre and that is not very convenient if you are spending only a few days. To be fair, the concierge staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not what youÂ´re used to.... even better”
Reviews.Author: Ed_MarieGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Qbic on a very rainy autumn weekend. Gladly we found out that there was a direct train connection from the airport to the Zuid station in Amsterdam. Safed us some valuable money for the rest of our city trip. A taxi ride in Amsterdam can, I believe, be very expensive while the train costs you about 3,5 euro. We were amazed by the big wtc building being so empty, we had to buzz ourselves in. Thought the hotel advertises as being a self service hotel, check in and check out using food machines, there was a very welcoming staff member who told us to ring him whenever we got stuck. The check in actually went easily. Once int the room we were amazed by the space and the furniture.. the Qubi. Looked realy cool and when we asked the staff member to change the lights he set all kinds of cool colours for us. The hotel itself is very easily reached by public transport and there are even night busses pendeling from midnight till early morning, again savinf you money. After a wild night of going out in Amsterdam it was great to stay in a nice and relaxed neighbourhood, away from the big and loud city, just 15 minutes away. We only wisehd we could have stayed in our bed longer since check out is 11.00 am. The only negative thing about hte room is that the toilet is open and that means not eating too much onions and beans, haha. Or just be very liberal with your partner, there are toilets a couple of seconds away from the rooms anyway. For the price, location and concept we will definetely look for Qbic again when we visit Amsterdam. Although the weather could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive hotel with little to offer”
Reviews.Author: munchers69
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel october 2008 whilst i can say that the hotel is clean the rooms leave a lot to be desired . there are no toilet doors so dont expect any privacy , no toilet brushes !!! no drinks facilities , no wardrobes , no mirrors , no heating and as promised on the qbic web-site no laptops in the rooms . all this for Â£103 per night . this hotel is 16 stops away from the city centre on the tram so save your money and get a better cheaper hotel to stay in nearer the centre . Avoid Qbic !!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'd Rather Go To Prison!”
Reviews.Author: trip_advice7
Reviews.Content: This was the WORST hotel we have ever stayed at! Our room did not have a window (couple that with the lack of normal-colored lights), the sheets had bread crumbs on them and we found an open condom wrapper by the bed. The worst part of it all is that there is no reception or ANYONE to complain to about all these disgusting things. So basically, we had no choice but to sleep in a dark room with used sheets. I have never felt more depressed by a hotel in my life. I got thirsty at around 11 o'clock and there were no open stores nearby (not even the convenience store in the subway station), so I was forced to buy a tiny 250ml water bottle from the hotel vending machine for the 'reasonable' price of 3 euros (~4.50). If I could give this hotel a minus, I would. it's not even worthy of one star.

Reviews.Title: “Good transport links, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: spititout
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a first-class hotel for a stay in Amsterdam. Located in the southern business area of the city, it is easily reached by train and tram from Schippol and Centraal Station, with no stress. If you are coming directly from Schippol, I would recommend taking the train direct to the hotel (8 mins - Â£3.50 Euros at Aug 08). Disembark at Station Zuid (sometimes called Amsterdam Zuid on the electronic ticket machines) and look for the WTC main entrance. Another tip - buy your train tickets in the arrivals area of the airport where you collect your baggage,and avoid queues in the station adjacent - you can use cards and cash in the machines. If you prefer to travel direct into Centraal Station, you can then pick up tram no 5 (just outside on the main plaza) which takes you to Station Zuid, and is roughly a 15 minute ride, though it is more cumbersome on trams with luggage than the train. I would recommend using the GVB information office outside Centraal Station (the white building around the scaffolding) for your travel passes, but remember to take a ticket and queue up! For a 96 hour city-wide tram pass, its 17.50 Euros, and is money well spent. The area around the hotel is very quiet at night, and we had 5 nights uninterrupted peace. There are a couple of cafes in the locale, and we preferred these to the hotel breakfast which was 10 Euros. We were impressed with the overall aesthetics of the hotel, size of rooms, and staff's attention. The bathroom designs have been covered elsewhere, though I will say I found them a little dark for shaving! Having stayed in Amsterdam numerous times before, I found the area to be pleasant, safe, clean and quiet, and would definitely use the hotel again. If you are on business at the WTC, it is perfectly placed and, in my opinon, as good as many hotels in the city that are double the price.

Reviews.Title: “Qbic: hip design and good value for mony”
Reviews.Author: HarmZwolle
Reviews.Content: For a visit to the theatric festival 'De Parade' I searched for a cheap hotel in Amsterdam. Qbic was intersting in price but specially in design. Although advertised as self-service there was a great staff who helped if neccesary. A pleasent stay for a pleasant price. Harm, Zwolle, The Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Qbic Hotel- a room with a difference..”
Reviews.Author: Damianek
Reviews.Content: WTC building and the hall entrance is breathtaking.. The room has a unique and minimalistic design..Bed is huge and very comfortable-bathroom has no door,not recommended if you want privacy from your room mate,ok if sharing with a partner. Ideal for a city break,short business travel and a different approach to staying in Amsterdam as that part of town-business City is a tram ride away and is quiet and has amazing architectural views..Will definitely visit again

Reviews.Title: “We Love QBIC!”
Reviews.Author: Jen E
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Qbic as part of a flight/hotel package deal. We specifically chose Qbic because it was closer to town than many of the other hotels on offer with the package. Qbic rooms are very unique and very comfortable. We had a lovely time during our stay of three nights and would highly recommend it. Our room was VERY comfortable, and due to the unique layout/design - the rooms are actually quite spacious despite its label as a pod hotel. The fact that there is not staff everywhere made this for a very private and quiet trip. (only usually one staff around if you need them, otherwise they come and bring fresh towels and soap each day). Also love the fact that there is a (free) safe in the room.... Bathroom is cool, best shower heads ever (they're huge!) and the beds are VERY comfortable. This is a great stay at a great price, privacy, security, comfort and location (far enough away from town to be quiet - 10 mins on tram to city centre and tram stops right outside hotel) and close enough to not feel like you are miles from everything. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Reviews.Title: “Unique, fun experiene!”
Reviews.Author: trigirl3225
Reviews.Content: We had looked at reviews and pictures prior to booking so we knew exactly what we should expect...and we were not disappointed. The hotel is in the WTC and easily accessible via the tram system - there is a stop that drops you off right in front of the WTC. Our room was great - green lights and yes, the bathroom that everyone was talking about but we thought it was just fine. We loved the bed with the lights and the TV built into the wall right above the bed - plus the bed was probably one of our softest and most comfortable throughout our Europe stay. The room was large, too, especially for Europe. When we arrived, we could not use the computerized check-in or out as we had booked through travelocity instead of QBIC directly however within seconds, an employee (always very friendly and helpful) was there to help us. Breakfast was 10 Euros and was good as well. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel especially if you are looking for something different and are open to new experiences!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: sg_Robin
Reviews.Content: Hi travellers, I have mixed feelings about staying in this hotel. Overall experience is ok but my stay would definitely had been better if they had made some improvements on some of the followings: Negatives: 1. Toilet - I have no issue with no toilet door but the lightings is so dim that I could hardly see myself (the room I was given had dim green lightings in the toilet, so maybe other colours are better - I am not sure. I am not sure about you but the idea of a toilet seat being attached to the end of my bed (separated by a panel) isn't exactly very exciting for me. I was here for 4 nights and to be honest for "big business" I rather use the public toilet located on every floor. 2. It's a little far from the town centre, about 15 to 20 mins tram ride. The tram you should take is number 5. Positivies: 1. Polite staff (especially one of the young male staff, really friendly and not intimidating. The other lady staff was a little more cold but polite) 2. Unique deco (minus the toilet experience) 3. Relatively clean and modern 4. Relatively safe as it's located within the WTC building Conclusion: If you have additional budget to spare, choose another hotel; otherwise this is quite value for money (as you know hotels in general in AMS can be really expensive). For very short stay (maybe a day or 2) it's ok; especially if you are the sort that party till the early morning and is only planning to come back during the day time for some sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good concept but dirty”
Reviews.Author: NoahTheHague
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Qbic for one night in a room without a window, which is fine for one night but is probably not convenient for longer stays. The bathroom is minimalist which works well but is missing a few essential features, such as a rack for towels and a tray for shampoo in the shower. The hotel is convenient for shorter stays and offers a value-for-money product for Amsterdam standards. Since the hotel is fairly new the hotel is in good condition but the main issue is that the rooms are not cleaned properly, which is probably due to poor lighting in the bedroom. The floor is very dusty, the bathroom is dirty and I doubt that the sheets were changed before our arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Cool, but for Singles ONLY!”
Reviews.Author: ttboydubai
Reviews.Content: I printed the directions on how to get to the Hotel, it would have been a bit confusing if I hadn't. The room is ok, especially if all you're looking for is a place to sleep at night and be out most of the day. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for a couple tho, there is no bathroom door, and very little storage space. All in all, you get your euros worth there. If I were to go to Ams again on business I would stay again, very easy as it is right next to WTC tram and Train Station.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find. GIve it a Go”
Reviews.Author: 2ROVERS2
Reviews.Content: Thought at first that this may be a bit weird but it was great. easy to get to from airport and 10minute metro ride into centre of Amsterdam. Big comfortable beds. Big television. Compact living. No airs and graces. No wardrobes drawers etc. but a great concept. Very clever idea. If you want luxury hotel attributes then pay the high prices in the centre of Amsterdam. if you want clean basic accomodation with a easy to use transport system just out of town this is perfect. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Relatively cheap boutique hotel, but certainly not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: StevenGray
Reviews.Content: First off, it's esasy to get to. From Schiphol just get the train to Amsterdam and get off at Station Zuid. Its them a 2 minute walk if that to the hotel, which is in the WTC. The train fair was â‚¬3,10 one way whereas the cab was â‚¬35,00. It's about a a 15/20 minute tram ride (line number 5 just outside the WTC door) to the Central Station and 10 minutes from the art galleries The room feels spacious and the modern design has the wow factor. The sofa and the bed were really comfortable and had a great nights sleep. The shower was great but the bathroom 'pod' has neither a door nor a towell rack which isn't so great. The staff were dead friendly and the self service kiosks were ok and there's a microwave.

Reviews.Title: “verry trendy”
Reviews.Author: Tommy74
Reviews.Content: it's particular special to stay. decoration is extremely trendy. what is not so good is the fact that there is no door between toilet and rest of the room! less than 10 minutes from town centre. in the weekend very cheep. recommended for a short stay www.qbichotels.com

Reviews.Title: “Not good!”
Reviews.Author: davetwo
Reviews.Content: I get the concept. But there are way too many flaws. Our room had no window! Apparently this is the case for about half the rooms here. And I cannot stress how claustrophoic this can be - and as you don't know what the weather's like (or indeed whether it's night or day) it's difficult knowing how to dress. The cube has no doors on the toilet and shower areas so you'd better be pretty liberal if you're sharing. Also the shower did not drain completely. No minibar I understand - but not even a glass or cup? It's not really central enough for tourists (which is fair enough). And it took me several passes to find it tucked away in an office complex. And it's not ever that cheap really. Don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Wierd, but good, overall”
Reviews.Author: The England Family
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the World Trade Centre's Tower C next to Amsterdam Zuid station. In that sense it was ideal - very easy to get to Schipol airport by train and very easy to get about Amsterdam itself by tram and by metro. If you arrive late, you get let in by ringing the intercom near to the revolving doors at the WTC entrance nearest to Zuid station and then walking through to tower C. You check in by computer which takes your details and gives you a card to enter your room. The rooms are well sized, have a good comfortable and big bed, a flat screen TV to watch when lying in bed or sitting at the 'bar' behind the bed which has bar stools. There's a comfy chair, lighting (and no, the neon really isn't that dominating) and somewhere to hang clothes and place a suitcase. All fine, clean, etc. The hotel kindly provided me with a small bar of soap, some shampoo, a plaster and a condom...but no glass to drink from.... The problems, really, were the bathroom and the ventilation. Of the latter, there was none, and no way to open the window to get some fresh air in so the room was quite hot even on a cold day in April. The bathroom was form over function, really. A sleek bowl-shaped sink, but nowhere to rest toothbrushes etc etc near it. The shower had one of those fantastic huge showerheads set above the showerer, rather than at an angle to the showerer, but it was set too low for me to stand comfortably under it. The swivel taps had hot and cold in one configuration on the sink and the opposite on the shower, so when you thought you knew how to get hot water by twisting in one direction, you got cold water instead. And the shower had no screen (nor the bathroom even a door) - fine, but it meant that the bathroom floor was constantly wet. Just very small practicalities which could be addressed with more towels or shower mats or something. Breakfast was good. Hot drinks and juices, cereals, fruit, pastries and cakes. Simple but fine, and there were vending machines selling food too, including perfectly good sandwiches and they were reasonable priced too. Overall, convenient, fine, clean, amply sized, but perhaps a bit spartan and certainly the bathrooms could be made somewhat more robust and endowed with practical features. As for price, OK for Amsterdam, but I guess you have to book well in advance to get a good price. I ended up paying E280 for two nights including breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: orion_8
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Qbic and I had a great time there. The hotel's super easy to find (just take a metro, tram, or train to Station Zuid -- it couldn't be easier). The room were actually very large compared to other European rooms I've stayed in, and the lobby/entrance area is awesome. My favorite part of the whole hotel were the vending machines in the lobby, which stock everything from beer to candy to toiletries. There's also a free computer to listen to in the lobby. The only downside is the doorless bathroom. It's a little weird, but everything else was so nice that it made up for that one flaw.

Reviews.Title: “Hip but hidious”
Reviews.Author: Mariska_Ilona
Reviews.Content: First impression: To access the hotel is incredibly hard. It's hidden inside the WTC building, security checks are througout the entire building. The service is not very friendly and you have to do everything yourself (check-in and faq). Underneath it's modern look and lavish interior decoration i's a cold, rough hotel. The rooms: No heating, no remote controls, no doors in the bathroom, low lighting, no phones, no drinking cups, no phones (i know we already had that but it's really annoying cause there is no cell phone service either and no public phone and no wake up calls), no alarmclock,. We asked if there is a restaurant near but they said no. Turned out there was lots of places at the trainstation. Besides that we were left a message by our friends but the guy forgot our roomnumber so we didn't get it.. Besides all of the above, it's an ok hotel for a business person that travels alone and only for 1 night (the bathroom floors will stay wet after showering). If you are traveling with 2 people be aware that they can hear, smell and enjoy all the sounds while you are on the toilet. Good luck! btw, we did get a free glass of orange juice for all the problems mentioned above (and it was good too!)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Business”
Reviews.Author: Sparafucile4
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and certainly very different. Did the job very well for a two night business stop over. Also note that the hotel is a 10 minute walk across an attractive park to the RAI conference and exhibition hall.

Reviews.Title: “Cool lights, annoying access, decent location”
Reviews.Author: PianoSteve
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at Qbic for two nights in early february. FACILITIES The room is great! bigger than most 3-5* hotel rooms we have stayed in and definately different... The lighting is good, with a constant blue colour, or groovy disco alternation between other colours. Reception was pretty good, with free internet, vending machines, books, seating area, and usually someone there to ask. LOCATION 10 minutes from Schiphol, and about the same from the city centre by tram. As part of WTC complex, it has excellent links, with a station for metro, tram, train or bus links. We bought a 3 day GVB ticket (Tram, Metro, Bus) for 14.50. Once there, Amsterdam is easily walkable, with attractions to suit all tastes. DOWNSIDES We stayed from Saturday - Monday, and over the entire weekend the WTC building was completely deserted (I mean, like a ghost town!!). This meant buzzing in to the building every time, and again at some automatic doors once inside. It doesn't sound like much hassle, but becomes rather annoying after the 3rd time! Checkout is at 11:00 so naturally we wanted somewhere to leave our luggage while we spent our final day in Amsterdam. The duty manager told us to leave it in the foyer as there are no lockers big enough to hold suitcases. This was fine with us as he assured us he'd be there all day - he was not there when we returned and the next duty manager seemed surprised when we pointed them out to him! It would be nice to have known they were safe in a locked room and not just left unattended in reception. All over, I give this hotel 4 stars for its cool interiors, great value and convenient location - it's only downside is its slightly annoying access during the weekend/lack of storage.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam's Secret Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brianc_li
Reviews.Content: For those wanting a cheap and easy Schiphol stopover this is well worth considering. Of all the 'Airport' hotels there are only three in the central Schiphol area. To access any of the others you have to take a shuttle bus. This hotel is a five minute walk from Amsterdam Zuid station from which there are frequent trains running the eight minute journey into Schiphol central. I booked this place because we had a 7am flight out so needed to be in Schiphol by 6. In my case I set my alarm for 5.15, left the hotel at 5.35, caught a train at 5.48 and was in the airport at 5.55. This is faster and more convenient than pretty well any other 'airport' hotel. At â‚¬69 for the night it also represented excellent value. Whilst I didn't spend a lot of time in it, my room was surprisingly spacious. It is a bit spartan in some respects. Pretty well everything the room has to offer is contained in the integral bed/bathroom/sitting bar unit pictured above. That said the bed was comfortable, there was a decent choice of TV programmes and the shower was good. What it sorely missed was any kind of wake up alarm system. There is no phone in the room and you couldn't set anything via the TV. Given its location and potential customer base this is, to my mind, a major oversight. Given its location in a commercial area to the South of Amsterdam I would not recommend this to anyone visiting Amsterdam as a tourist. The nearby Artemis is a much better hotel and often has similar rates. Even that, like this place, is a bit far out of the center of town. For those going in/out of Schiphol or with business in Amsterdam Zuid/Amstelveen it is well worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: hendrik_mertens
Reviews.Content: Hotel very very OK, also for business. You can actually get some work done here, the rooms have desk space and an internet connection. Don't hesitate if you're planning to visit RAI, Amsterdam's exhibition & congress centre. It's nearby. For the lowest rates, book early, they use "yield management" just like the low cost airlines do. To go to the city centre, take the tram in front of the building. It's fast and costs way less than parking space or a taxi. Parking fees inside WTC, where Qbic is situated, are outrageous (75 euros for 24 hours) and there are no alternatives nearby. As a Qbic guest, you pay 29,50 euros / 24 hours, remember to ask for your Qbic parking card before leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & nice location - beware of the parking”
Reviews.Author: letsmeet
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really cute, I loved the design of the WTC area, the inside living spaces and room. I had some problems with the toilet door which doesn't exist.. but this is part of the "Qbic" fun! Also there's no hairdryer and you cannot rent it from the reception either. The location is not in the centre but the metro is very frequent and connects you to the central station in 15 mins. Actually I thought it was better not to stay downtown as Amsterdam can be very noisy and somewhat dangerous at night. The only inconvenient I had was with the parking: the Hotel website doesn't say that parking in the WTC is not included and that it costs 3,60 euros per hour (external) or 75 euros per day (internal)! I was arriving there on Friday evening and I knew that the WTC was closed over weekends, so I assumed that the external parking was free as well. But when I called the reception to have a confirmation, they told me that the parking (internal or external) had to be paid for also on weekends and offered me to park inside with a special discount for "only" 29 euros/day. I was clever enough not to follow their suggestion and I found an external parking lot with a meter: I just had to pay for one hour (3,60 euros) and could stay until the next Monday morning. Conclusion: the Qbic offer to park for 29 euros is convenient on weekdays, but they should not make you pay also on weekends when the external parking is free!

Reviews.Title: “WACKY HALLWAYS; DUTCH SPACECADETS!”
Reviews.Author: travelmaddy
Reviews.Content: What a cool place. 5 minutes by train from amsterdam schiphol, so great when you are flying out from amsterdam, which we were. also good for a weekend in amsterdam, if you can manage the tram, metros and train. Only a 30 minute walk from downtown amsterdam. It is in amsterdam zuid, WTC, which is a very nice area. It is like a village on it's own, with great restaurants and shop. The walk from there into the towncentre is great, you can't get a better area in amsterdam. Make sure you've got a good map. You can also take the tram 25, which will take you to leidseplein and so on. The rooms are great, and so cheap, I paid 40 euro for a double. They are spacious, hastens bed (!!), great shower and a lcd tv. The hallways are a bit peculiar, looks like a bamboo forest and it smells like skunk, at first I thought there were some people smoking some, but after a while I realised, that it was some sort of airfreshner; the dutch are a bit quirky.... great sense of humor. Breakfast was okay, very relaxing area. Overall a great place to stay, will go again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Overll good and smart hotel...but a bit far off”
Reviews.Author: ABHIRAI
Reviews.Content: Hi. I stayed for just a night. The hotel website has directions to reach and this was informative but the location is a bit far from central station..... Just 1 staff was polite and proactive...else breakfast is Ã¢ bit expensive as compared to other hotels The hotel has smart look and feel but the checkin -out machine could be a more quick and effiective...and also bathroom level was a bit strange as water kept logging --....The hotel is a design and "smart" hotel and at this price is goodt o expereince once....atleast.

Reviews.Title: “Qbic - perfect for business, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: B0bble
Reviews.Content: This new hotel in the business district of Amsterdam (it is actually in the World Trade Centre building) is excellent. It is no-frills accommodation at its best - the rooms are a decent size and clean. The reception area is useful (lots of vending machines selling everything from coffee to batteries) and although you shouldn't need their assistance (check-in is done by computer) the receptionists are friendly. I would thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Both thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: Snou
Reviews.Content: To keep it short: + very modern interieur, big points for the huge bed and the lights + classy and trendy, perfect for young couples + very nice and helpful service + safe, clean and exquisite accomodation in the WTC + very good connection via tram line 5 along all the hotspots + a safe in the room - like mentioned in all the reviews before, some people will probably miss a bathroom door; but there are more toilets on each floor - also very clean - shower is flooding the bathroom - nothing dramatic Both thumbs up! :)

Reviews.Title: “Wicked place!”
Reviews.Author: playtoy1979
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at Qbic for 3 nights just before Christmas. Loved the room, the concept, the price and the location. Had no problem finding the Hotel at all. Location was perfect....really 10 mins from the center. The room was cool, loved the lights, the bed and the TV. Though I did miss a shelf in the bathroom and a bit more frequent cleaning under the beds...but this won't put me off staying there next time! Staff were helpful and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Jillikinz
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this hotel! It is so new, clean and funky. The rooms are great, so different to normal hotel rooms. Lovely big, comfy bed and a powerful shower. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We stayed for two nights, and you probably couldn't stay for much longer than that, due to lack of storage space, but great for a little city break. The hotel is located between the airport and the centre, and it takes about 10-15 mins to get to each. I booked a couple of months in advance, so got the room for a very good price, and I feel that I got more than I paid for. Will definitely be going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: kerry026
Reviews.Content: This place was absolutely amazing - very clean, fun. The location was perfect for us - not in the center of everything but a quick tram ride to town. (The tram was just downstairs, out the door and to the left ... easy to get to.) The room was not traditional, the "cubic" set up is not for those who prefer the run-of-the-mill Holiday Inn kind of hotel. The bathroom had no door, and there was only a half-panel of frosted glass between you and the rest of the bathroom, but it wasn't a problem for us. (Could be a problem if someone opens the room door - they'll get a peek, but that didn't happen). Easy access to the internet in the lobby, good variety of channels on the TV, the water in the bathroom was always hot, the towels clean and the room outfitted with many IKEA-brand items. (Which I love!) The staff was VERY friendly and willing to point you in the direction of whatever kind of activity you're going for while in town. There was a breakfast available, but we didn't partake, but a nice grab-and-go (translation: vending machines) section. The price (2 Euro!) for a can of soda was disconcerting, but the room was so cheap, I didn't mind. WARNING: This hotel is located in the World Trade Center - DO NOT PARK IN THE WORLD TRADE CENTER!! We made that mistake for our three-night trip when I failed to notice the parking was 75 EURO A DAY! Ye-ouch. The car's stay was pretty much twice the cost of our room each night. Lesson learned! Last words - I'd book again here in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, Hip, Cool but COLD!!”
Reviews.Author: SSS009
Reviews.Content: The room is clean, nicely outlayed, excellent lightings which u can switch colour of the light. Looked exactly the same as posted from the web. However, temp in the room was low all the time, even after several requests to turn it up, but not helping at all. Very challenging to use the bathroom, no rack nor hanger for ur stuffs, not even a place to hang your used towels. Also, due to the design, u can easily flood the whole bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “very nice concept and hotel”
Reviews.Author: abaggi
Reviews.Content: "Very nice" only can describe this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Qbic”
Reviews.Author: LauraC28
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay, no doubt best value for money ever experienced

Reviews.Title: “Qbic is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: AngieV
Reviews.Content: We loved the Qbic, is was a little far from the city center, but did have a tram stop right outside the hotel, making it a quick trip, and a train station for easy access to Schipol airport. I loved the bed, it's extremely comfortable, which is rare in Amsterdam, and the room was very quiet because of the location. The bathroom was nice, but it was not private at all...That was really the only downside. We stayed for one night, so it wasn't a big deal, but i see how it could create a problem. Overall this was a very nice hotel and i would definetly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great new concept”
Reviews.Content: Once you find the right building and the correct entrance, the wonderfully fresh design welcomes you. The beds are great, the best you'll find in any hotel of any quality. If you're looking for a standard quality hotel with "normal" features, this may not be the place for you. However if you want to experience a new concept that offers what modern, city travellers need, this is definitely for you.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about it!”
Reviews.Author: RodFourn
Reviews.Content: Tons of issues, this place has problems. Bad 1) No outside signage of any kind, its in a mall hidden away nicely. 2) You have to be buzzed in after the mall closes, what a hasle. 3) No thermostat in the room and windows don't open. 4) No towel holders in the bathroom 5) No soap dish for the shower. 6) No bathroom door, not cool if you are staying with someone. 7) No shower curtain or door, water got everywhere including on the toliet paper. 8) No bathroom fan!! So you steam up the room 9) I requested 2 beds and got them, but they don't come a part! So my buddy had to sleep on the funky couch. 10) I am almost 6 feet tall and the bed boxed me in, I slept diagionally so my feet could fit. Not good to tall people! Good 1) Price 2) Location, just take the 5 into Central Station BAM in the red light disctrict! 3) Free WiFI and computers in the lobby, 1 Mac, 1 PC. Nice! 4) Free snacks 5) Nice staff and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The good outweighs the bad”
Reviews.Author: Cassiu5
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel very early and got an excellent price per night for Amsterdam. This is the first Qbic Hotel, and I think they made a few mistakes with their 'hip hotel' concept in this first attempt, but overall the idea is a good one. They need to give better directions for a start! The World Trade Centre is a big place and while it is on a direct route from Schipol airport, when you arrive at night it's a confusing place. It was only because a previous reviewer had mentioned the hotel was in block C that I managed to see the small sign in the window by the revolving door. You need to ring the buzzer and ask for entry. Once inside the staff helped me check in. There always appeared to be staff present in reception, which is decorated in a very funky Ikea style. I was lucky and had a room with a window, which offered much needed natural light (though not much of a view). The room was very clean with a large comfortable bed. You can pick different mood lighting, but this is more of a novelty than practical. The bathroom is a bit odd, all open, no doors, must be a bit off putting if sharing the room. The shower is very strong, but the water does not drain at all well and can slop over the sides into the toliet area if you take your time. Also, the showerhead is set at around 6 foot, which makes it a little impractical for tall people (and the dutch are very tall). There is no loo holder or towel hooks, strange how the little things niggle you after 6 nights. Finally - I had no cupboard space, only a coatstand with coat hangers Plus sides are the size of the room (huge for Amsterdam); the easy access to Amsterdam (trams and metro system, or less than an hours stroll along the canals); the price is incredibly cheap for Amsterdam if you book early enough; the staff are friendly; the rooms are in a quiet location (though some building work is carried out over the weekend, this being an office block); the rooms are new and modern, without sagging beds and worn carpets! All in all, the Qbic hotels have some teething problems which I hope they resolve, but it is so much better than the previous hotels I have stayed at in Amsterdam/

Reviews.Title: “Liked the bed very much”
Reviews.Author: C188
Reviews.Content: This new design hotel was located near the centre, so this was a big plus. The room has a wonderful bed but the toilet was not separated by a door. At checkout we're offered a coffee and some sweet pastry. This was very much appreciated. Given the room and location of the hotel my 79 euros were very well spend!

Reviews.Title: “Funky but prob wouldnt stay here again”
Reviews.Author: MISSNUNEZ
Reviews.Content: The location itself is ok. Its not far from the city centre but it may seem far if you travel by tram as the tram stops at every corner so the journey seems longer! The hotel itself to look at is really nice and funky and very clean and artsy. To check in is easy and although we needed assistance, someone was there to help and he was always available during the time we were there, if he was needed. We didnt get a window room so we never knew what the weather was like outside nor what time of day it was. Its a good thing my boyfriend had a watch! The TV is situated in a stupid place as u cant really see it due to the glare, they need to bring it down a bit as its too high. The bathroom. Well, if you are not comfortable with going to the toilet in front of your partner, then dont stay here as its an open plan bathroom. Also, if either of you were to do a smelly number 2, it would stink out the whole room. Luckily we didnt experience this but it is a possibility if someone's poos dont smell nice! You cant smoke in the hotel which is something I wasnt initially told but it didnt really matter. Overall it is a nice hotel, but I wasnt overly impressed and would stay somewhere closer to town next time.

Reviews.Title: “Funky spot, but imperfect”
Reviews.Author: travelteam07
Reviews.Content: Great location, right on the tram line, easy access to city center for tourists. Free internet in the lobby is nice. Large beds, comfortable, and lots of sunshine through big windows. Quirks: no front desk or consistent staff presence, no door on the shower/bathroom, no phone or clock in the room, and bed/TV setup that makes it difficult to watch comfortably. The colored lights above the beds are great fun, but don't work reliably. It seems like the place was thrown together quickly. And a note: use discretion with who you bring along -- we had photos of condoms on the wall of our room.

HotelInfo.Name: Qbic Hotel Amsterdam WTC
HotelInfo.Address: Mathijs Vermeulenpad 1, Amsterdam 1077, The Netherlands
